title: Systemutvecklare
description:
*Vi är ett av Sveriges största SaaS-bolag som genom innovativ teknik digitaliserar byggbranschen för att göra den säkrare, mer produktiv och mer hållbar. Hos oss blir du en del av ett kreativt team där du får utvecklas, ta dig an spännande utmaningar och samtidigt ha kul på vägen! Vi söker nu fler kollegor som vill vara med på resan att digitalisera en av världens största branscher och bidra till ett hållbart samhälle.*


Är du en erfaren systemutvecklare med god arkitekturförståelse och ett proaktivt arbetssätt? Brinner du för att ta tekniskt ansvar, driva förbättringar och leverera välstrukturerad kod som gör verklig skillnad i verksamheten? Då kan detta vara nästa steg i karriären för dig! Vi söker nu en Systemutvecklare till vårt team på Infobric E&A, Workorder i Karlskrona.  

  

  



**Det här kommer du att göra:**


I rollen som Systemutvecklare inom Infobric, E&A blir du en nyckelperson i utvecklingen av Infobric Workorders nästa generations mobilapp för iOS och Android. Ditt uppdrag är att tillsammans med ett erfaret och engagerat team ta fram moderna, stabila och användarvänliga lösningar som förenklar vardagen för våra kunder. Du arbetar självgående med både frontend- och backendnära utveckling, med fokus på React-baserad apputveckling, där kvalitet, prestanda och långsiktighet är centrala ledord. Rollen kombinerar självständigt arbete med nära samverkan i ett team på sex personer, där idéer, erfarenheter och lösningsförslag delas öppet.


Du kommer arbeta på vårt kontor i Karlskrona, beläget nära Karlskrona C, i en kreativ miljö som uppmuntrar till tekniskt ansvarstagande, kunskapsutbyte och kontinuerlig utveckling.

* **Utveckling av nästa generations mobilapp för iOS och Android**, med fokus på React-baserad apputveckling, användarupplevelse och teknisk kvalitet.
* **Självständigt genomföra utvecklingsuppgifter i ett agilt arbetssätt**, från planering och implementation till test och leverans i korta iterationer.
* **Arbeta med React, JavaScript och relaterade tekniker** för att bygga robust och modern funktionalitet anpassad för mobila plattformar.
* **Delta i kontinuerlig förbättring av kodbas, arkitektur och utvecklingsprocess**, med fokus på långsiktighet och underhållbarhet.
* **Bidra till ett effektivt agilt arbetssätt** genom att ta ansvar för egna uppgifter, hålla åtaganden och anpassa arbetet utifrån gemensamma prioriteringar.

**Vad söker vi hos dig:**  

Vi lägger stor vikt vid din erfarenhet, din tekniska förståelse och din förmåga att omsätta kunskap till fungerande lösningar i praktiken. Vi välkomnar sökande med akademisk bakgrund och ser utbildning som ett värdefullt komplement till praktisk erfarenhet. Det viktigaste för oss är att du har rätt kompetens för rollen och trivs med att arbeta självgående i ett agilt utvecklingsteam där fokus ligger på kvalitet, leverans och kontinuerlig förbättring.  

  

Rollen passar dig som trivs med att driva ditt arbete framåt, ta initiativ och vara med tidigt i en ny teknisk satsning där du får möjlighet att medverka med kunskap, erfarenhet och nyskapande.

**Vad vi erbjuder :**

* Var med och skapa förändring i en av världens största industrier
* Möjlighet att växa och utvecklas i ett snabbväxande techbolag som påbörjat sin internationella expansion
* Stöttande kollegor och en dynamisk och innovativ arbetsmiljö
* Flexibel arbetsmodell - du utgår från något av våra härliga kontor där du spenderar den mesta tiden, men behöver du jobba hemma finns det möjlighet till det
* Företagsevent, after work, pingisturneringar och såklart mycket fika. Vi gillar att ha roligt tillsammans!
* Bra förmånspaket – vi tar hand om dig

 **Teamet du blir en del av:**  

Du blir en del av **Workorder-teamet i Karlskrona**, ett sammansvetsat utvecklingsteam med bred teknisk kompetens och lång erfarenhet av både produktutveckling och byggbranschens verkliga behov. Teamet arbetar nära produktägare och verksamhet för att omsätta kundinsikter till stabila och användarvänliga lösningar.


Vi har en **öppen och prestigelös teamkultur** där idéer uppmuntras, tekniska diskussioner är en naturlig del av vardagen och där vi gärna delar kunskap med varandra. Här finns stort utrymme att ta ansvar, påverka tekniska vägval och vara med tidigt i utvecklingen av vår nästa generations mobilapp. Samtidigt värnar vi om balans, trivsel och att ha roligt tillsammans – både i och utanför koden.

 **Så här söker du tjänsten**


Sök enkelt med din LinkedInprofil eller bifoga CV. Vi gör löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas snabbt så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!

title: Fullstackutvecklare till Rahmqvist Group
description:
**Fullstackutvecklare till Rahmqvist Group**


Vi på Rahmqvist Group söker just nu en vass och kreativ Fullstackutvecklare som vill vara med på en spännande utvecklingsresa. Hos Rahmqvist får du möjlighet att ta tekniskt ansvar för vidareutvecklingen av vårt CRM och relaterade system, som dagligen stödjer ett stort antal säljare i fält. Dessa system är avgörande för prospektering, kundbearbetning, orderhistorik och uppföljning. Du kommer att arbeta med hela utvecklingskedjan, från backend-logik och API:er till frontend-komponenter, filtreringar, kartfunktioner och integrationer mot externa system. Dessutom kommer du att implementera och integrera AI-modeller för att förbättra våra verktyg ytterligare.


I denna roll får du arbeta i en innovativ miljö där ditt arbete verkligen gör skillnad.

**Arbetsuppgifter**

* Ansvara för vidareutvecklingen av Rahmqvists CRM, en central komponent för säljstöd och kundhantering
* Arbeta med hela utvecklingskedjan från backend-logik och API:er till frontend-utveckling och systemintegrationer
* Implementera och integrera AI-modeller för att göra systemen smartare
* Underhålla och förbättra befintliga systemlösningar

**Din profil**

* Minst 3-5 års erfarenhet av fullstackutveckling
* Förmåga att driva projekt från backend och frontend till release
* God kommunikationsförmåga för att förklara tekniska beslut för icke-tekniska produktägare
* Förståelse för säljprocesser och förmåga att översätta dem till funktionell design
* Initiativrik, med förmåga att se helheten och föreslå förbättringar
* Social, samarbetsinriktad, nyfiken och anpassningsbar
* Intresse och kunskap inom utveckling av AI-lösningar

**Tekniska krav**

* C# och .NET 9
* Web API
* Entity Framework Core 8
* MS SQL
* React 18
* TypeScript
* Erfarenhet av att bygga integrationer (till exempel mot Salesforce eller liknande system)
* God förståelse för att bygga användarvänliga, responsiva gränssnitt (iPad är primär enhet)
* Erfarenhet av Azure (hosting, deployment, miljöhantering)

**Meriterande**

* GraphQL (HotChocolate)
* Docker

**Vi erbjuder:**

* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter i ett nytänkande företag
* En kultur som kännetecknas av sammanhållning och öppenhet
* Tjänstepension och friskvårdsbidrag på 4.000kr
* Trygghets- och sjukförsäkring
* 30 semesterdagar
* Härliga lokaler på Lidingö - med möjlighet till hybridarbete


Känns detta som en roll för dig? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

*Eric Rahmqvist AB grundades 1953 av Signe och Eric Rahmqvist och är än idag en familjär koncern med över 400 anställda i 11 länder. Vi är experter på allt som har med arbetsplatser att göra och fokuserar på hållbarhet och innovation. Rahmqvistgruppen strävar efter att hjälpa medarbetare att skapa roligare, mer effektiva och hållbara arbetsdagar inom områden som första hjälpen, ergonomi, visuell kommunikation och arbetsmiljö.*
company_description: Rahmqvistgruppen är en internationell koncern med drygt 300 anställda som arbetar för att bidra till en bättre arbetsdag för våra kunder.

title: Systemutvecklare till IT-bolag i tillväxt!
description:
##### **Vi växer och vill bli fler! Vi söker flera Systemutvecklare (C, C++, Python och/eller Java) till vårt team i Stockholm. Välkommen att bli en del av vårt härliga gäng!**


I rollen som konsult hos oss får du ett omväxlande jobb med en mängd olika arbetsuppgifter. Du kommer att erbjudas konsultuppdrag där du snabbt utvecklar din egen kompetens och kunskap inom relevanta områden. Våra kunder är främst medelstora och stora företag med intressanta miljöer i teknisk framkant.

  

Vi sitter i fina lokaler i centrala Sundbyberg, nära till olika typer a förbindelser såsom tvärbana, tunnelbana, pendeltåg och bussar.

#### **Vem är du?**


Vi söker dig som har ett stort tekniskt intresse, som drivs av att arbeta med ny teknik och att hänga med i branschens utveckling. Att du gillar att koda och att hitta lösningar på problem ser vi som en självklarhet. Du är en positiv och prestigelös person som bidrar till ett bra arbetsklimat och en god teamkänsla. Du trivs med nya utmaningar och tar egna initiativ. Vi tror att du är analytiskt lagd, har en nyfiken personlighet, gillar att arbeta systematiskt och har båda fötterna på jorden. I ditt arbete som konsult läggs stor vikt på att kunna samarbeta med andra på ett konstruktivt sätt och att kunna leverera projekt på utsatt tid.


Vi söker dig som har högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen inom IT och **minst 4 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet**. Vi ser gärna att du har goda kunskaper inom något av programmeringsspråken C, C++, Python och/eller Java. Du ska ha god förståelse för agila utvecklingsmetoder, exempelvis Scrum. **Är du certifierad Scrum Master, med minst 4 års relevant erfarenhet är det meriterande**. Du ska även ha goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift.

**Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd, vilket kan innebära krav på visst medborgarskap. Detta uppdrag kräver även godkänd bakgrundskontroll och en ordnad ekonomi.**

#### **Varför ska du jobba hos oss?**


Gillar du att arbeta med teknik i den yttersta framkant av teknologisk utveckling så är vi trygga med att kunna tillgodose ditt behov. För oss är det också av yttersta vikt att på riktigt ta hand om vår personal. Därför ser vi oss själva som det lilla familjära företaget, även om vi idag har kontor i både Linköping, Stockholm, Luleå och Västerås. Vi har även verksamhet i Göteborg.


Vi uppskattar när våra medarbetare tar med sig sina personliga intressen till vår arbetsplats och vi erbjuder generösa personalförmåner och ser till att vi har kul tillsammans genom sociala aktiviteter.

#### **Vilka är vi?**


SysPartner grundades 2005 och erbjuder konsultation inom infrastruktur och systemutveckling samt hostinglösningar och helhetskoncept för IT-drift. Våra konsulter får ofta chansen att arbeta i en större organisation med spännande tekniska lösningar hos våra kunder, samtidigt som vi har alla fördelar med att vara ett mindre och familjärt företag.


Välkommen med din ansökan via vårt rekryteringssystem!

title: SEB Tech Trainee Programme 2026-27: Solution Developer | SEB, Stockholm
description:
**Do you want to challenge, change, and steer our company into the future? Are you passionate about technology and ready to make a difference? Then you will thrive at SEB.**
 At SEB, we believe in fresh thinking, new working methods, and innovation to create a fairer and more sustainable world. Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success, while we place a strong emphasis on sustainability and digitalization as we shape the future of SEB.
   

  

 With the Tech Trainee Programme and as an employee, we'll help you develop new skills and take on more responsibility to create a positive impact.
 **You will become a crucial key player in shaping the future of the bank.**
 Your Tech Trainee position and your team
   

  

**Join SEB’s journey to become a data-driven bank!** 
 We believe every team member has the potential to grow and make a real impact - no matter where you start.
   

  

**As a developer in SEB’s IT Asset Management team, you will** 
 be part of a dynamic and collaborative team that values continuous learning and shared responsibility.
   

  

 Our open culture encourages knowledge sharing through pair programming, problem-solving workshops, and regular ‘Demo Fridays’. The development team consists of a mix of junior and senior developers.
   

  

**In Your Role, You Will**
* Help us deliver innovative and data-driven solutions
* Be part of an Agile delivery team, contributing throughout the entire lifecycle—from design to production support
* Develop line-of-business applications with a strong focus on IT Asset management, playing a key role in delivering solutions in close collaboration with stakeholders and cross-functional teams
* Be able to work across the full stack, as the delivery area continues to grow – from database modelling and back-end development to APIs, user interfaces, and integrations with other critical systems within the bank
* Be supported by experienced colleagues and encouraged to experiment, ask questions, and develop new skills every day


**Our Tech Stack**
* .NET, C#
* Angular, TypeScript, HTML/CSS
* REST APIs
* GitHub, CI/CD
* SQL Server
* Visual Studio Professional and VS Code
* Kubernetes
* GitHub Copilot


 Simultaneously by working in the role you are being recruited to,
 **you will participate in SEB's Tech Trainee Programme for six months** 
 . It will give you the opportunity to develop an extensive network within the bank, gain a deep understanding of the financial industry and our global tech organization, and be professionally and personally challenged.
   

  

 As part of the programme, you can expect to: contribute to meaningful projects, work on tech tracks, gain communication and leadership skills, and participate in a hackathon and a business challenge.
   

  

 Key traits to thrive in this role and programme
   

  

 We’re looking for young talents who are curious, motivated, and ready to question the status quo.
   

  

**To thrive in this role and in the Tech Trainee Programme, we believe you have:**
* Graduated within the past two years, or will graduate before the programme starts on 1st September 2026 – from a relevant academic degree or a two-year vocational education in IT or tech
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to take ownership
* Great communication skills and to be able to work in English
* Some experience or interest in technologies like .NET, Angular, and REST APIs, or are motivated to learn them with our support


**We Also Believe You**
* Bring curiosity and a collaborative spirit to our team, ready to tackle challenges together
* Value teamwork, open communication, and shared responsibility


 Previous experience (part-time work, student projects, labs in IT/Tech etc.) and involvement during your studies are advantageous but
 **what matters most is your potential and passion** 
 .
   

  

 In our recruitment, SEB behaviours are something we consider when choosing whom to hire. These behaviours include creating value, acting long-term, and building positive relationships.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A six-month trainee programme, designed for professional and personal development
* A full-time employment in the role you have been hired for, after completing the programme successfully
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Networking and collaboration opportunities
* A real business challenge to solve with other participants in the Tech Trainee and International Trainee programmes, where you can create value and make a difference for SEB
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Mentorship from senior leaders


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 The application period for the Tech Trainee programme is open until 11th January 2026 23:59 CET.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact career@seb.se, but we will not process applications via e-mail.
   

  

 The Tech Trainee Programme will start on 1st September 2026.
   

  

**Our recruitment process**
 We want to get to know you, and for you to get to know us.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Includes**
* Psychometric tests
* Interviews – digitally and/or on-site
* A case exercise and presentation
* SEB Day – an event to learn more about SEB and the programme, with insights from former trainees


 Please note that the Alva Labs assessments will be connected to the email you applied with.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Find out more about the Tech Trainee Programme here: Tech Programme | SEB
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Dotnet Developer
description:
I have a new role for an experienced C# .NET Developer to work for a leading digital transformation partner, driving innovation with tailored IT solutions, expert consulting, and secure technology for businesses across diverse industries worldwide, who are going through an exciting growth phase.
 



  





 There are based both in Stockholm and Skane County this is a Hybrid position.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Develop and maintain .NET-based applications for clients.
* Collaborate closely with customers and colleagues to create innovative and business-critical solutions.
* Work within agile teams to deliver high-quality software solutions.
* Participate in digital transformation projects across multiple industries, including telecom and the public sector.
* Contribute to knowledge sharing and teamwork within the organization.
* Ensure security, flexibility, and scalability in software development.
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices to enhance development processes



  





**Qualifications** 



* Proficient in C# .NET
* Strong consulting mindset with a passion for collaboration and knowledge sharing
* Experience with JavaScript, Azure, or microservices is a plus.
* Fluent Swedish & English



  





 Salary - Up to 60,000 SEK Depending on experience
 



  





 This is a great opportunity for anyone that's looking for growth opportunities with one of the worlds biggest consultancies

title: App Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Senior experience in app development, preferably with multiplatform frameworks (such as React Native or Kotlin Multiplatform), but also with deep knowledge of iOS and/or Android.
* Experience with authentication, app security, or digital identity is highly meritorious.
* Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies and integration solutions.
* Experience working with hardware-related features (Bluetooth, NFC) and encryption is strongly desired.
* Used to working in small, autonomous teams and able to take on significant responsibility.


**Application deadline:** 
 14-01-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: System Developer
description:
Join our team and help build the tools that power Lumera’s applications. As a System Developer in Operations, you will develop internal test tools, installation solutions, and our containerised platform, primarily in Rust, with close integration with Java. For the right candidate, there is an opportunity to take on a leading role in coordinating communication between the team and the Product Owner.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Develop supporting products in Rust that contribute to the company’s core offering, while collaborating closely with the Kubernetes-based platform on which the product ecosystem runs.
* Work with Docker containers on Linux, supporting product delivery through CI/CD pipelines using tools such as GitLab.
* Contribute to development in and around our Java-based core systems.
* Collaborate closely within the team, often through pair programming.


**What You’ll Be Getting**
* Amazing colleagues, among the best in our field.
* Daily challenges that keep you engaged and motivated.
* Flexible hybrid work options, with the possibility to work remotely up to two days per week.
* A culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing.
* Benefits designed to support a healthy work-life balance.
* Conveniently located offices in Stockholm


**To Thrive In This Role, You**
* Hold a Bachelor’s or Master's degree within IT/Computer Science or related fields.
* Are a recent graduate or bring a couple of years of experience as a system developer.
* Are proficient in English and Swedish, both spoken and written.
* Have relevant education and experience with our tech stack, which primarily includes Rust, Python, Java, Bash, Docker, Helm, and Kubernetes.


*Personal characteristics*
* Demonstrate drive, curiosity, and a solution-oriented approach.
* Are comfortable working in a distributed team with a strong hybrid-remote culture.
* Enjoy working collaboratively and value teamwork.
* Actively seek to learn from more senior colleagues.
* Show interest in taking initiative, coordinating team efforts, and facilitating agile ways of working.


 Does this sound like the perfect fit for you? Apply today by sending us your CV or applying via LinkedIn. A background check will be conducted as part of the recruitment process. For any inquiries or general questions, contact Felix Wallin at felix.wallin@lumera.com.  We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Please note that the recruitment process with interviews will begin in mid January 2026.**
**About Lumera**
 Lumera is dedicated to the digital transformation of the European Life and Pensions industry. As insurtech innovators, we provide future-proof core technology for policy administration.
   

  

 The Prudent Revolution is our mission – bridging technology and partnership to navigate the fastest, safest path through complex change for L&P providers.
   

  

 We combine tech and industry expertise with relevant market experience to offer a broad range of consultancy and data services – from managing faultless legacy system migration to facilitating compelling end-user experiences.
   

  

 Based in Stockholm, Lumera has significant presence with offices in the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Norway, Sweden, India and Vietnam.
   

  

 Lumera is majority owned by Monterro, a leading Nordic software investor.
   

  

 www.lumera.com
   

  

 Follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

 We are Lumera - pioneering the digital transformation of the Life and Pensions industry. With strategic partnerships and advanced automation, we streamline policy administration, making complex processes simpler. Our mission, The Prudent Revolution, guides L&P providers through change, ensuring a smooth transition. Trusted for migrations and armed with deep domain expertise and innovative AI solutions, Lumera shapes the future. Join us on this innovative journey!

title: Senior C# Developer to the Accounts Channels Team | SEB, Solna
description:
Are you passionate about new technology and making a difference? Join our digital transformation!
   

  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating and building the tech arena of the future. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Senior Developer in the Accounts Channels team at SEB, you will play a crucial role in driving the development and implementation of SEB’s account administration services and interest rate services. Our solution is in-house developed based on standardized tech stack and technology. You will be a member of a team of talented developers, ensuring the delivery of high-quality software that meets the needs of our business and customers.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* You will be a key member of an agile development team.
* Work with our core tech stack: C#, PostgreSQL, OpenShift, GitHub actions, Angular.
* Work in a team of developers, fostering a collaborative and communicative environment.
* Conduct investigations into technical, architectural, and methodological directions, and participate in hands-on development.
* Collaborate closely with product owners and other stakeholders to define, design, and ship new features.
* Ensure performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
* Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation.


 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

 We are looking for a candidate with strong technical skills and a passion for leadership and communication.
   

  

**The Ideal Candidate Will Have**
* Curiosity and willingness to learn new things, actively seek solutions and find enjoyment in speaking with domain experts in both IT and business.
* Good communication and pedagogical skills, with the ability to present and discuss technical topics effectively.
* Proven experience in C# development and SOLID principles.
* Working experience with agile development practices and CI/CD.
* Enjoy analyzing, presenting, and discussing technical topics.
* Fluency in English.


 What we offer
   

  

* Innovative company in forefront of technology.
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Work-life balance.
* Friendly and welcoming culture.
* The position is located in our office in Solna, where we work 3 days at the office and two days from home.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 10 of Jan 2026. If you have questions about the position, please contact Jia Linder via jia.linder@seb.se.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
*Every year, 6 billion SEK of personal accident insurance compensation goes unclaimed in Sweden. Why?* 




 Because navigating the claims process is confusing, time-consuming and overwhelming. At Insurello, we believe the insurance claims process should
 *work for people* 
 - not against them. We’re building a tech-powered platform that helps individuals claim the compensation they’re entitled to, with ease and clarity.
 



 We’ve already helped over 50,000 people claim more than 1 billion SEK, and we’re just getting started. Now, we’re looking for a
 **Fullstack Software Engineer** 
 to help us build the next generation of our product and make insurance accessible for millions.
 



  





  





**Why Insurello?** 




  




* Tackle a meaningful challenge:
 **transforming an outdated insurance industry** 
 and building a product that genuinely improves people’s lives.
* Join an
 **empowered, cross-functional product** 
**team** 
 with full ownership of its mission – including significant influence over technical decisions, ways of working, and shaping the product to create customer value.
* Work in a
 **warm, collaborative culture** 
 with passionate teammates who value learning, knowledge-sharing, and building technology that truly helps others.



  





  





**What Will You Do?** 




  




* Work in a cross-functional empowered team to define and develop the product on both strategic and technical levels.
* Build fullstack features using functional programming principles.
* Contribute to system design and domain modeling.
* Work with event-driven patterns, integrations, and cloud-first architecture.
* Collaborate through pair & mob programming to build shared ownership and quality.
* Participate actively in product discovery, planning, and continuous improvement.
* Share learnings across teams to drive clarity, alignment, and innovation.
* Explore AI tools to improve development flow, reduce manual work, and deliver value more efficiently.



  





  





**What stack will you work with?** 




  




* **Languages & frameworks:** 
 Elm, TypeScript, F#, ASP.NET Core. We’re passionate about functional programming, and hope that you are interested in it too.
* **DBs:** 
 PostgreSQL
* **Data & events:** 
 Event sourcing, RabbitMQ
* **Infrastructure:** 
 AWS platform



  





  





**Who are we looking for?** 




  





 From a
 **technical perspective** 
 , we’re looking for someone who has:
 


* 6+ years of fullstack development experience.
* Interest in and experience with technologies from our stack or similar ones (such as Elm, TypeScript, F#, or other functional programming languages).
* Experience with AWS or another major cloud platform.
* Practical experience using AI-assisted engineering tools and applying AI to improve workflows or user-facing processes.
* Knowledge of system design, ideally with domain-driven thinking.
* Strong understanding of web technologies beyond frameworks.
* Experience with event-driven systems, event sourcing, or distributed systems.
* Professional fluency in both English and Swedish.



  





 On a
 **personal level** 
 , a great fit for the role is:
 


* Curious, collaborative, and focused on simplicity, clarity and pragmatic decisions.
* Someone who enjoys owning both the problem and the solution - from understanding the domain to building, deploying and learning from what one ships.
* A product-minded engineer who codes with purpose: you understand the customer problem as well as the business possibilities and limitations.
* A challenger who speaks up, shares opinions, and encourages experimentation and innovation.



  





  





**The Culture** 




  





 At Insurello we live by our values:
 


* **We care for people** 
 – fostering inclusion, empathy, and support.
* **We innovate for impact** 
 – delivering meaningful results for our customers.
* **We nurture trust** 
 – valuing transparency and collaboration in all we do.



 As for the
 **Product & Tech team** 
 , our manifesto is simple:
 


* Clarity over complexity
* Learning through experiments
* Shared direction, local decisions
* Quality through collaboration
* Simplicity and cost-effectiveness in everything we build



 If you're excited about fullstack development, modern cloud technologies, and exploring how AI can elevate engineering and customer value - we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





  





**Our benefits:** 



* 🌴 30 days of paid annual vacation
* 🌿 Occupational pension plan in Avanza
* 🏋️ 5000 SEK wellness benefit
* ⏱ Flexible hybrid work opportunities with the team based in Stockholm (we work from office 1-2 days/week)
* 🫄 Parental pay top-up
* 🎐 Personal therapy sessions
* 🛡 Occupational injury insurance that applies around the clock – both at work and during free time
* 🥐 Weekly team breakfasts
* 💃 Regular after-work gatherings and company events – including an annual offsite in May



  





**Let’s transform the insurance industry together. 🚀**

title: Senior Solution Engineer to SWIFT team | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 We are responsible for maintaining and developing SWIFT eco system within SEB - 7 off the shelf products developed by SWIFT running on over 50 Linux and Oracle servers.
   

  

 We provide reliable connectivity to the global SWIFT Network 24/7 and operational support to our business partners and stakeholders. Cross collaboration and interaction with other SEB teams with focus on accuracy and timely delivery are essence of our work.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
 To succeed in this position, you need to have a strong personal drive, be curious and understand the importance of the connection between business, operations and IT. You have proven problem-solving skills and experience from IT-development and maintenance. You will work with a large network of people and stakeholders within SEB, so great communication skills are highly important. You are a team player who is not only focused on self-development but also help on developing the team´s competence.
   

  

**Other Skills You Need To Succeed In This Position**
* DevSecOps mindset – design, build, test, deploy, support
* Experience in Linux & programming like bash, python or java
* Agile way of working
* Fluent in English
* Outgoing & positive team player
* Flexible and able to take ownership
* Manage your time & prioritize
* Up for a challenge and suggest new ideas
* Academic degree in IT area


**As a Solution Developer You Will Be Responsible For**
* Configure and maintain different SWIFT products
* Integrate different components e.g. using MQ, REST APIs
* Contribute to automation and CI/CD journey using Ansible, GitHub Actions
* Support stakeholders on everyday issues
* Be part of our day and night on-call support


**What We Offer**
* Work-life balance
* Friendly and welcoming culture
* Long-term stability
* Opportunity to help transform the industry
* Agile and modern ways of working


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial to our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe, or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2026-01-13. If you have questions about the position, please contact hiring manager Jenny Sakkas Nusias at jenny.sakkas@seb.se, but we will not be able process applications via email.
   

  

 As part of this recruitment process, the final candidate will undergo an extended security screening. This may include, but is not limited to, identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug tests.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

*Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.*
 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Developer - React Native (Stockholm or Malmö)
description:
**About Elite Prospects** 




  





 Elite Prospects is the world’s leading hockey platform and the central hub connecting fans, players, agents, scouts, and executives. As the true gateway to hockey, we create opportunities for players while serving as the global community destination for everything related to the game.
 



 With more than thirty thousand paying subscribers, over five hundred thousand registered members, and six million unique monthly visitors, Elite Prospects continues to cement its role as the digital heartbeat of hockey. We are now looking for a UI/UX Designer who wants to help shape the future of hockey technology.
 



  





 We are looking for an experienced React native developer to join our Product and Tech team.
 



  





 You’ll be a key addition to our special teams, driving the play, setting up scoring chances, and helping the entire lineup perform at its peak.
 



  





 We aim to become a world-class engineering team that combines speed with excellence, that other divisions can rely on completely, and that pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in our product. It is a tight roster where collaboration, creativity, and strong passing plays are part of our daily game.
 



  





 We are primarily based in Malmö and Stockholm and we are looking for someone to work on-site with us.
 



  





**What You Will Work On** 




  





 Right now we are reshaping our web and app experience with the ambition to become the “LinkedIn of Hockey.” This means strengthening network effects and delivering a personalized, persona-driven experience that adapts onboarding, features, and workflows to the unique needs of players, professionals, organizations and fans.
 



  





 You will help us create experiences that keep the hockey world informed, inspired, and always one stride ahead.
 



  





**Your Player Type** 




  




* Pragmatic and proactive
* React native, React\*, Nextjs\*, Graphql
* Strong TypeScript skills
* Ability to write clean, testable, well-structured code
* Understanding of performance implications and async behavior
* Deep understanding of CSS architecture
* Can work independently and break down complex tasks
* Can mentor others and give/receive feedback



  





**Who You Are** 




  




* At least 5 years of qualified work experience after completing your post secondary education
* Fluent in English. Swedish fluency is a bonus
* A hockey or sports interest is very welcome
* A genuine passion for software development and modern technology
* Someone who keeps up with the latest trends and learns new things easily
* Enjoy working with agile development methods
* As a person, we believe you:
* Take initiative and help drive the process forward when we are under pressure in the box
* Are a true team player who prioritizes collective success over individual stats



  





**Practical Information** 




  





 This is a full time role based at our tech office in central Malmö or Stockholm. We are recruiting one position to each office.
 



 Address: Djaknegatan 9 (Malmö) and Gamla brogatan 11 (Stockholm)
 



 We want you to be on site at least four days per week. Trust us, once you get to know the team you will want to be there. Working together face to face makes everything more fun and helps us level up faster.
 



  





**What We Offer** 




  




* The chance to work on a very exciting, fast growing product that we fully believe in
* A skilled and friendly team that values collaboration, shared success, and having fun together
* A welcoming and inclusive culture



  





**Some examples of what we do as a team** 




  




* An annual conference where we gather every colleague from across more than three continents
* A strong focus on competence development including monthly learning sessions
* Frequent after work activities and fun games at the office



  





 If you want to join a team that builds the future of hockey technology and enjoy doing it, then Elite Prospects is ready to take the ice with you.

title: Fullstack Developer – Digital Marketing and CRM
description:
**You could call it a Fullstack Developer role—but we’re really looking for someone who enables seamless, personalized customer journeys through smart technology.**
 The CRM and Marketing Solutions unit at If P&C Insurance is advancing its capabilities in data driven marketing and supporting a digital first strategy. To create customer-centric solutions in this area we utilize many data sources and turn them into event-driven personalized solutions with high business impact.
   

  

 We want to offer our customers personalized journeys driven by important life events. You will have a key role in making this happen.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Fullstack Developer, you will be developing APIs, integrations and applications to enable us to communicate with leads and customers in a safe and secure way and ensure that If can reach out in any channel through our new Bloomreach Engagement CDP platform and transform data into personalized customer journeys. You’ll join an easy-going Nordic team of developers who make this happen and have fun while doing it.
   

  

 You’ll develop B2C and B2B integrations solutions in .Net and C# in Azure Cloud and connect them to our omni-channel CRM touchpoints (email, SMS, web, CX, app, chat and marketing channels) and first party data sources so we can communicate with leads, partners and customers. This includes development and integration to CRM data sources both in Azure, on-premise and to partners via APIs, reliable and asynchronous messaging, and various other channels of data communication. You will practice Agile and DevOps in your day-to-day life.
   

  

**We offer**
* An including work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits
* Lunch benefit
* High pension savings


**About The Team**
 We’re a Nordic team of highly motivated developers who are passionate about serving customers with timely, personalized communications to help them live a worry-free life and insure what is most dear to them. We work closely with business stakeholders to make this happen and value common Agile DevOps principles with CI/CD so we can continuously deploy value to clients.
   

  

 We promote continuous tech nurturing, certifications and learning including hackathons both within our team and together with our partners at Microsoft, Bloomreach and Google. We love experimentation and constantly follow new technology to create better solutions.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 You’re passionate about solution development in
 **Azure** 
 and have a solid understanding
 **of Object-Oriented Programming** 
 using
 **.Net** 
 and
 **C#** 
 .
   

  

 You bring:
   

  

* Strong experience with .NET, C#, and Object-Oriented Programming.
* Experience developing solutions in Azure Cloud.
* Proficiency in REST APIs, microservices, and message-based architectures.
* Solid knowledge of Azure data storage (SQL Server, CosmosDB, Azure Storage).
* Awareness of Information security and protecting our customers’ integrity (GDPR).
* Bonus: Experience with React for UI development.


 You also have:
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Proven experience in application and software development.


**Additional Facts And Recruitment Process**
**Application** 
**Deadline** 
 : Screening and interviewing will be conducted on a rolling basis, however application deadline is January 16th, 2026.
   

**Work location:** 
 Stockholm (Sweden) or Turku (Finland).
   

**To apply for the position:** 
 Please attach your CV.
   

**Travelling:** 
 Occasional travel within the Nordics.
   

  

**Start:** 
 As soon as possible or by agreement.
   

  

 For more information, please contact Santiago Varela, Chapter Lead MarTech Fullstack Development, santiago.varela@if.no.
   

  

 Final candidates will undergo a background check before employment.
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Senior Fullstack utvecklare till Liminity!
description:
Liminity växer snabbt med fler kunder och spännande projekt. Vi söker en erfaren utvecklare som vill ta stort tekniskt ansvar och samtidigt hjälpa juniora kollegor att växa.
   

  

 Rollen
   

  

 Du kodar, designar lösningar och driver tekniska beslut. Projekten varierar – en dag bygger du en AI-integration, nästa handlar det om Power Apps eller en ny feature i en fullstack-app. Du delar gärna med dig av din kunskap genom code reviews och informell coachning.
   

  

 Teknikstack
   

  

* Frontend: Next.js, React, TypeScript, Tailwind
* Backend: FastAPI, Python, PostgreSQL
* Plattformar: Microsoft 365, Azure
* DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD
* Test: Jest, Pytest, Playwright
* AI: AI SDK


 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

* Gedigen erfarenhet som fullstackutvecklare
* Djup kunskap i TypeScript och moderna ramverk (helst Next.js/React)
* Erfarenhet av Python och FastAPI
* Vana vid att bygga integrationer mellan system och tjänster
* Förmåga att självständigt driva ditt arbete framåt


 Bonus
   

  

* Erfarenhet av LangChain eller andra AI-ramverk
* Jobbat med Power Platform
* Bidragit till open source

title: Integration Developer
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du själv önskar, där du ingår i en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över, och där du får chansen att omdefiniera vad som är möjligt. Våra Cloud & Custom applications-team fokuserar på att utveckla skräddarsydda cloudapplikationer, integrera IT-system och driva affärstransformation, med leverans av affärskritiska cloudlösningar i hög kvalitet och hastighet, möjliggjort av Generative AI. Bli en del av oss och hjälp världsledande organisationer att frigöra teknikens värde och bygga en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Integrationsutvecklare på Capgemini blir du en del av ett engagerat konsultteam där din tekniska kompetens står i centrum. Du kommer att arbeta med utveckling och implementering av avancerade integrationslösningar, där du bidrar med din expertis i plattformsövergångar, transformationsinitiativ och löpande förvaltning. Hos oss anställs du för din kompetens – inte för ett specifikt uppdrag. Det innebär att du får möjlighet att arbeta med varierande projekt och kunder, samtidigt som du kontinuerligt utvecklas i din roll. Vi uppmuntrar rotation mellan uppdrag för att främja lärande och innovation. I denna roll kommer du att ha en nyckelposition i ett eller flera projekt, där du bidrar till att skapa värde för våra kunder genom smarta och hållbara integrationslösningar.
   

  

*I denna position kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:*
* Designa, implementera och underhålla integrationer samt genomföra analyser och utveckla strategier för att framtidssäkra integrationsmetoder, inklusive etablering av Centers for Enablement.
* Genomföra molnmigreringar till Azure med hjälp av Azure integrationstjänster, hantera generell plattformsosäkerhet och underlätta övergångar mellan tekniska plattformar.
* Stödja andra transformationer såsom ERP för att påskynda leverans och bidra till Capgeminis interna nätverk samt andra initiativ som utvecklar vår verksamhet.
* Utveckla strategier för att framtidssäkra integrationsmetoder och etablera Centers for Enablement som en del av den långsiktiga tekniska plattformsutvecklingen.


**Din profil**
* Gedigen erfarenhet av integrationsutveckling, API-design och eventdrivna lösningar – gärna med specialisering inom MuleSoft Anypoint, Boomi, Apigee, Kafka, Solace eller motsvarande teknologier.
* Van att arbeta i agila team och moderna utvecklingsmiljöer med fokus på samarbete och kontinuerlig förbättring.
* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande kompetens, samt god kommunikativ förmåga i både svenska och engelska – i tal och skrift.
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av andra hyperskalers integrationslösningar (t.ex. AWS, GCP) och ett intresse för generativ AI.


**Vad vi tror kommer att få dig att trivas**
* Inspirerande arbetsmiljö med fokus på innovation, kundnöjdhet och samarbete – du arbetar med de senaste trenderna inom Cloud & Application Integration tillsammans med skickliga kollegor i ett erfaret team som levererar till både offentlig och privat sektor.
* Globalt och lokalt nätverk inom Cloud & Application Integration som ger tillgång till expertis, stöd och kunskapsutbyte – både i Norden och internationellt – för att lyckas i det dagliga arbetet.
* Kontinuerlig utveckling och karriärmöjligheter, inklusive tillgång till över 250 000 kurser och certifieringar, regelbundna samtal med din teamchef om uppdrag och utveckling, samt en värderingsdriven kultur med fokus på Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty och Fun.


**Ansökan**
*Just nu har vi ledighet och hoppas även du njuter av en glädjefull semester! Vi ser framemot att läsa igenom din ansökan när vi är tillbaka från vår ledighet och förväntar oss att kunna återkoppla dig mot mitten av januari när vi är åter. Stort tack för ditt tålamod!*
*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.*
**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en AI-driven global partner för affärs- och tekniktransformation som levererar konkret verksamhetsnytta. Vi formar framtiden för organisationer och förverkligar den med hjälp av AI, teknik och människor. Med vår starka historia på nästan 60 år är vi en ansvarsfull och mångsidig koncern med 420 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Genom vår expertis inom strategi, teknik, design, ingenjörstjänster och affärsverksamhet levererar vi heltäckande tjänster och lösningar, baserade på vår djupa branschkunskap och vårt omfattande partnernätverk. Koncernen rapporterade globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro för 2024.
   

  

**Make it real** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Platform Engineer - Developer Experience
description:
**TL;DR** 
 We are seeking a Platform Engineer to enhance and scale Lovable's developer experience. In this role, you will be responsible for critical components of our stack, ensuring our engineering workflows are faster, smoother, and more
 **Lovable** 
 .
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* You have strong programming skills and a track record of improving developer velocity and system reliability.
* 7+ years of experience working in a platform team supporting developer experience (o11y, CI/CD, application frameworks, productivity tooling, etc).
* You’ve written code and tools to support growing engineering orgs in scale-ups.
* You have experience with Docker, Kubernetes and modern infrastructure practices.
* You’re a problem-solver who thrives on challenges and ships high-leverage systems fast.
* You’re comfortable navigating ambiguity and solving problems as they arise.
* You care about security, stability, and speed and know when to make trade-offs between them.
* You’re based in Stockholm or ready to relocate - this is an on-site, 5-days-a-week role.


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence:** 
 Own and scale the developer experience at Lovable, making our engineering teams the most productive in the world.
   

  

* Bring order and structure to our code base.
* Integrate or build application frameworks to support a growing engineering organization and code footprint
* Own and develop our observability stack, from code instrumentation through ingestion to presentation.
* Integrating tools for AI driven development.
* Identify and drive reliability improvement efforts across all engineering teams.


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love. Lovable platform engineers are capable of working across the whole stack. Examples of tech in our stack include:
   

  

* Frontend: React and Typescript.
* Backend: Golang and Rust.
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Modal.
* Data: Clickhouse, Firestore, Spanner, BigQuery.
* DevOps Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, OTEL, Grafana, kubernetes, terraform.
* Local Tooling: Nix, DevEnv.


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

title: Senior Backend / Data engineer
description:
We are looking for a Senior Backend / Data Engineer to join Safe-and-Sound i.e. the centralized Safety team for PZN located within the AI Foundations Studio. We build state-of-the-art solutions to meet all safety needs for the studio. Our product suite covers a range of core assets on the platform (such as Search, home / podcast recommendations) and newer GenAI products (such as AI Playlisting, video trailers), tier 0 services like Recs Filtering, and production pipelines serving products like Search and Home. We work closely with squads in Tech Research and Trust & Safety to prototype and develop novel techniques to continually push the envelope and think more deeply about holistic content and user sensitivity.
   

  

 We’re seeking either someone experienced in data development who has an interest in t-shaping into backend or the opposite around. You will build the backend/data systems that power our application, scale highly distributed systems serving our state of art solutions in production, and continuously improve our engineering practices. Above all, your work will impact the way the world experiences music.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Design tech specifications with product partners
* Write large-scale production quality data pipelines
* Architect, design, develop, deploy and operate services for the team that serve millions of users
* Be a technical leader within the team you work with and within the company in general
* Be a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional agile team
* Be a leader of the client-wide backend/data developer community affecting and driving our architecture across the company
* Hack on what you want during regular hack days and bi-annual hack weeks


 Who You Are
   

  

* Experience with delivering end-to-end production-quality data/backend solutions at scale
* Experience with designing tech specs and modular architectures for frameworks in ambiguous problem spaces
* Expertise with Ray, Hendrix, Scio, Java, Python, Dbt, BigQuery, Sql
* Experience/Interest in collaborating across multiple teams in various disciplines
* Experience/Interest in taking ownership in complex, ambiguous problem spaces


 Workplace: Sweden
   

  

 Start: Feb
   

  

 Length: 6 months

title: Intranet Developer
description:
**Job Title: Senior Intranet developer - Optimizely** 




**Location: Solna, Stockholm, Sweden** 




**Client: Multinational Power Company** 




**Assignment Start: 19 th January 2026** 




**Assignment End: 31 st December 2026** 




**Assignment Type: Residential** 




**Work Schedule: 8 Hours per day / 5 days a week** 




  





**JOB DESCRIPTION** 




 We are looking for 2 consultants who will ensure operation of our client's intranet platform based on Optimizely (EpiServer) which is operated in Azure. It also includes integrations and some peripheral systems.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Ensure the reliable operation, maintenance, and ongoing development of the intranet platform
* Support and enhance solutions built on Optimizely (Episerver) in an Azure-hosted environment
* Manage and support integrations with SharePoint (Online and On-Prem) and Microsoft 365 services
