title: IT Systems & Support Technician
description:
**\*\*YOU MUST BE A CITIZEN OF THE EU OR EEA OR HAVE VALID WORK PERMIT TO WORK IN SWEDEN.\*\*** 




**This is a full-time, onsite position based in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




  





 Do you have a passion for gaming and IT operations? As a part of my3Twelve, you will have an opportunity to join a dynamic team supporting a global enterprise client. My3Twelve is seeking a technically skilled professional who thrives in both hands-on IT support and strategic systems administration. This role is ideal for someone eager to grow into advanced responsibilities, independently drive projects, and act as a technical project manager with minimal oversight. 
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 
  
 


* Provide front-line technical support, troubleshooting hardware/software issues, and delivering desktop support across multiple platforms
* Manage onboarding/offboarding IT tasks (PC build-out, dev kit setup, etc.)
* Maintain and optimize a large fleet of test devices (Windows, Android, Chrome OS, etc.)
* Transition lab operations to cloud-hosted environments
* Develop and deploy automation scripts (PowerShell or similar)
* Set up lab infrastructure (racking, cabling, servers, provisioning)
* Own and improve processes for managing technical requests, tracking issues, and communicating status
* Deliver both tactical (day-to-day) and strategic (long-term) IT projects
* Evaluate and recommend hardware solutions for diverse technical needs
* Monitor, maintain, and secure servers, networks, and computer systems
* Implement system updates, patches, backups, and disaster recovery operations
* Ensure compliance with security, privacy, and regulatory requirements
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve issues and enhance system performance
* Document IT procedures and system configurations
* Independently drive projects to completion, acting as a technical project manager:
* Develop project plans and timelines
* Proactively identify and mitigate risks
* Communicate project status and milestones to stakeholders
* Facilitate team meetings and stakeholder reviews
* Track KPIs and project outcomes
* Capture lessons learned and implemented best practices



  





**Qualifications** 
  
 


* 3–5 years’ experience in IT operations or similar roles
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
* Strong scripting skills (PowerShell, C# preferred)
* Deep knowledge of operating systems (Windows, Linux), as well as using and automating Azure and XML
* Experience with network administration, security, and Azure virtual machines
* Familiarity with corporate IT environments (AAD, AD, Directory Services, SharePoint, ADO)
* Experience with ITIL-based helpdesk systems and ticketing platforms (JIRA, Autotask, Kaseya, etc.)
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively
* Service-minded, positive, can-do attitude



  





**Highly Recommended:** 
  
 


* Experience in IT operations/engineering for a game studio
* Certifications: CompTIA Network+, CompTIA Security+, Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate
* Experience troubleshooting client issues in complex corporate environments
* Experience in technical lab environments and front-line IT operations



  





 Pay: 25 000 - 50 000 SEK per month

title: L2 Desktop Support (Ad-hoc / Doctor's Day support)
description:
**About us** 




 We are a global provider of IT Resources, IT Managed Services and flexible, ad-hoc IT Resource and Project Support. Founded in 1992, we have a proven track record of delivering business solutions to global organisations and Fortune 500 companies in over 40 countries. Over the last 33 years, we have delivered millions of pounds in cost savings to our clients. With offices in the UK, Europe, India and the US, we have clients spread across all 6 continents. Our clients and our talented people have always guided our basic strategy and direction; so much so that we named the company after our most basic principles. We are, and always will be, allied to our client's needs and objectives. Our team is at the heart of our business, and we are proud of each one of them. They are exceptional, and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us.
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 



1. Provide 2nd Line on-site desktop and application support services to end users
2. Troubleshoot and resolve incidents relating to Desktop operating systems and mobile devices
3. Repair hardware and peripheral faults in conjunction with warranty providers
4. Take ownership of personal ticket queues and support colleagues when necessary to improve customer satisfaction whilst achieving contractual SLAs
5. Operate cohesively with the service desk team to maintain service levels
6. All work undertaken must be logged via a Service Desk Reporting Tool, and this must be kept up to date and accurately and clearly indicate the incident details and remedial actions taken.
7. Escalate all critical and high-priority incidents to line and senior management
8. Report recurring incidents to problem analyst teams and line management
9. Proactively contribute to service improvement initiatives
10. Provide technical expertise and assistance on project assignments



  





**Behavioural skills required:** 



1. Must have very good customer-facing skills and be well-presented
2. Must have an assertive, confident, positive, and professional manner
3. Ability to engage and communicate effectively with colleagues and customers alike
4. Demonstrates independent and proactive thinking
5. Highly organised with the ability to adapt to different working environments seamlessly
6. Builds effective relationships both within the team and across the business scope
7. Must be able to work to specified standards and required levels of deportment, conduct, and sound ethical workplace practices
8. Must be able to work alone and unsupervised, taking the initiative when necessary
9. Has an understanding and respect for service delivery processes.



  





**Technical skills required:** 



1. Experience of operating within a Service Desk environment and team, supporting users either remotely or onsite and managing tickets through an Incident Management tool
2. Excellent all-round knowledge of Windows Desktop Operating Systems, with recent support experience in Windows 7 and 10
3. Excellent support experience with mobile devices, e.g. tablets and smartphones running iOS and Android OS
4. Working knowledge of current and legacy hardware platforms
5. Strong background in supporting the latest Microsoft Office suite on Windows and Mac platforms with recent support.
6. Good Knowledge of TCP/IP and Network configuration at a Desktop OS level
7. Enterprise-level support of Active Directory and Exchange for troubleshooting, configuration, and administration activities
8. Previous experience in the creation of technical support documentation
9. Enterprise support of Microsoft Office 365, desktop, and Admin
10. Knowledge of Service Management processes, e.g. ITIL
11. Previous experience working in a managed service environment, working to a defined scope and with strict SLAs
12. Exposure to Infrastructure technologies – Server, Networks, etc
13. Working knowledge of Mac OSx, Latest Windows OS (preferably A+, MCP or MCSE qualified) and related Office applications.
14. Basic knowledge of LAN/WAN, TCP/IP Protocol, Citrix, routers, and switches
15. Basic experience in Support/administration of Windows servers
16. Basic experience with Windows Server and associated architecture/services (Active Directory, Group Policy, server roles, DHCP, DNS, IIS)
17. Installation, configuration and troubleshooting of hardware and software.



  





**Experience & Qualifications:** 



1. Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in 1st and 2nd level Support, at least 3+ years at level 2

title: Onsite IT Technician
description:
The world is changing in the way we consume products, from ownership to usership, and DigitalRoute is positioned in the centre of the transition. Because, when enterprises pivot to usage-based business models, they often make an unfortunate discovery. Their systems weren’t built to handle the massive data volumes and complexity that usage-based models generate. This causes them to leak revenue and respond too slowly to customer demand. DigitalRoute solves this by creating a real-time usage data layer for enterprises. Our products transform raw usage data into clear information for billing, in real time and at high scale.
 



  





 This is a hands-on support role with a clear destination: Junior System Administrator within 6–12 months.
 



  





 You'll be the go-to IT person for our Stockholm office while also helping colleagues across our global teams. The work is practical, setting up laptops, troubleshooting access issues, keeping meeting rooms functional, and answering the questions that pop up ten times a day. But there's room to grow into real system administration work: managing Entra ID, Intune, Microsoft 365 admin, and access policies.
 



  





 You'll also get early exposure to how AI is changing IT support, we're actively building and improving an internal AI support bot, and we want someone who's curious about where this is heading.
 



  





 We're a modern SaaS company. You'll work with Windows and macOS, Microsoft 365, Entra ID/AD, Intune, Kandji, Jira, Confluence, and Slack. No legacy nightmares.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Keep people working. Provide L1/L2 support, onsite and remote. Laptops, phones, docks, screens, printers, video conferencing. When something breaks, you fix it. When someone's locked out, you get them back in.
* Set up new joiners. Run IT onboarding. Make sure new hires have working equipment and know how to use our tools from day one.
* Maintain our systems. Help manage Entra ID/AD, Intune, Kandji, and our asset inventory. Create documentation and knowledge base articles. Contribute to our AI support bot (yes, really, we're building one).
* Grow into admin work. As you get comfortable, you'll take on more: Microsoft 365 administration, SSO configuration, access management, device configuration and compliance policies. This isn't a dead-end support gig.



  





**What You'll Bring** 




 Some hands-on IT support experience, service desk, onsite support, internships, or student roles all count. We care more about how you think and communicate than how many years you've logged.
 



  





 You should understand the basics: Entra ID/AD concepts, Windows and macOS, Microsoft 365. You don't need to be an expert.
 



  





 Beyond Technical Skills, We Want Someone Who:
 


* Actually, likes helping people (and stays patient when the same question comes up again)
* Communicates clearly in English, written and spoken
* Stays organised when juggling multiple requests
* Documents their work without being asked
* Is curious about AI and how it's changing IT work. You don't need to be technical, just interested
* Wants to learn and grow



  





 Bonus points if you've used Intune, Kandji, Confluence, Slack, or any asset management/CMDB tools or played around with AI assistants and chatbots.
 



  





**Why join us?** 



* A real growth path with support to get there
* Modern tools, no legacy headaches
* Hands-on experience with AI in a practical IT context
* High visibility in a global, growing company
* A team that actually wants your input on how to do things better



  





 We look forward to receiving your application and a short note about your IT support background and what draws you to this role. We read every application.
 



  





 We follow a continuous selection process, and the position may be filled before the last application date.
 



  





 DigitalRoute is committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse environment, and we actively encourage qualified candidates of all genders, sexual orientations, ethnicities, disabilities, and ages to apply. Join our global and diverse company, where our differences are our strengths.

title: Medarbetare till IT-Supporten, Capio St: Görans sjukhus
description:
****Om oss****
 IT-avdelningens grunduppdrag är att ge sjukhuset bästa möjliga IT-stöd i vårt hälso- och sjukvårdsuppdrag. Vi gör det genom att alltid fokusera på stabilitet, säkerhet och flexibilitet.
   

  

 Vår avdelning är placerad nära den verksamhet vi finns till för och vi har ett brett uppdrag - vi sköter om allt från drift av nätverk och servrar, systemutveckling och systemförvaltning såväl som supporten gentemot användarna.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en underbar människa med stort hjärta, med teknisk förståelse och kompetens som vill hjälpa till att lösa små och stora utmaningar med fart och precision. där vi får direkt återkoppling på det vi bistår med.
   

  

 Några interna omdömen om vår IT-Support:
   

  

 "Otroligt snabba, vänliga, tålmodiga och värdefulla för oss. Drop-in var en jättebra lösning. Tack!"
   

  

 "Ni är så värdefulla! Tack för alla fin hjälp ni ger"
   

  

 "Alltid snabba på att lösa IT-problemen"
   

  

 "Alltid hjälpsamma och tålmodiga!! Fantastiskt gäng."
   

  

 "Ni är superbra och jätteviktiga!"
   

  

****Din roll****
 Du kommer att bli en del av IT-supportorganisationen och samarbeta nära med både kollegor inom samtliga områden på IT-avdelningen såväl som användare och beslutsfattare i verksamheten.
   

  

 Att vara första linjens support på IT-avdelningen på Capio S:t Görans Sjukhus innefattar huvudsakligen att ta emot, åtgärda och genomföra förbättringar efter mindre och större fel och incidenter. Arbetet utförs via ärendehanteringssystem, telefon och på plats ute i verksamheten.
   

  

 Du kommer arbeta i ett rullande schema med "inne support" i två veckor och "utesupport" i två veckor. Inne support innebär att du löser ärenden via vår supportportal och via telefon. I den rollen finns det möjlighet att arbeta på distans. Utesupport innebär att du fysiskt är på plats, hjälper medarbetare med allt från uppkoppling, konfiguration, felsökning av nät etc inom sjukhusets väggar. Fysiskt arbete kommer att förekomma.
   

  

 Planering, prioritering och genomförande av förändringsärenden, projektdeltagande samt att kontinuerligt arbeta med kommunikation och information är också grundläggande.
   

  

 Uppdraget inkluderar schemalagda kompenserande beredskapsperioder, där inställningstiden är en timme.
   

  

 Precis som alla verksamheter inom Capio S:t Görans Sjukhus arbetar vi enligt vårt koncept med ständiga förbättringar; alla anställda har uppdraget att kontinuerligt påverka och förbättra vår verksamhet.
   

  

****Vi erbjuder dig****
 Du som vill arbeta med och utveckla vår IT-support är varmt välkommen till en arbetsplats där vi är stolta över vår bredd inom kompetens, förutsättningar och bakgrunder.
   

  

 Vi är i dagsläget fem medarbetare och tar hand om ca 30 000 supportärenden per år, varav hälften löser vi själva. Resten tar vi hjälp av andra inom verksamheten och externa parter.
   

  

 Hos oss får du som har stor vilja och drivkraft goda möjligheter att växa med ansvar och utvecklas med de utmaningar som ditt uppdrag medför.
   

  

* Kollektivavtal
* Närvarande chef
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Som anställd har du fri tillgång till vårt gym.
* En inkluderande arbetsplats där vi lär av varandra
* En planerad introduktion med mentor


****Om dig****
 Krav är att du har erfarenhet av arbete i en helpdesk/supportorganisation och att du behärskar svenska mycket bra i tal och skrift då kommunikationsförmåga och skicklighet kring informationssammanställning är avgörande.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har relevant IT utbildning på minst gymnasienivå.
   

  

 Din tekniska kompetens kring klienter, klientplattformar, kringutrustning och system är självklart hög. I din generella kompetens finns förstås också kontohantering och behörigheter och de olika tjänster och funktioner som finns för att hantera detta.
   

  

 En förmåga att bemöta medarbetare på deras villkor och förklara utifrån deras IT mognad är en nyckelkompetens.
   

  

 Som person vill vi att du är engagerad, driven och social. Du är fokuserad, kvalitetsmedveten och förstår vikten av prioritering och planering i arbetsvardagen.
   

  

 Har du erfarenhet av att ha arbetat inom vården tidigare är det meriterande.
   

  

****Ansökan****
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Annonsen kan därför tas bort tidigare än planerat, så vänta inte - skicka in din ansökan redan idag.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Vid frågor angående tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef daniel.norling@capiostgoran.se
   

  

**Publicerat** 
 : 2026-01-07
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag** 
 : 2026-02-08
   

  

 Vi undanber oss vänligt men bestämt all direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av jobbannonser.

title: SEB International Trainee Programme 2026-27: Data Analyst | SEB, Stockholm
description:
**Do you want to challenge, change, and steer our company into the future? Are you ready to make your mark on the finance industry and positively shape the world? Then you will thrive at SEB.**
 At SEB, we believe in fresh thinking, new working methods, and innovation to create a fairer and more sustainable world. Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success, while sustainability and digitalization influence our long-term strategy.
   

  

 With the International Trainee Programme and as an employee, we'll help you develop new skills and take on more responsibility to create a positive impact.
 **You will become a crucial key player in shaping the future of the bank** 
 .
   

  

 Your Trainee position and your team
   

  

**Do you see the potential in data analytics and want to contribute to accelerating the data journey by applying advanced analytics techniques?** 
 Join SEB’s Group & Business Services (GBS) Data & Analytics team, where the mission is to empower Group & Business Services by unlocking the potential of data. They provide support to strengthen organizations’ data capabilities, enabling data-driven insights and supporting intelligent automation across Group & Business Services.
   

  

**As a Data Analyst, You Will**
* Support the team in driving various data initiatives
* Collaborate with data professionals and stakeholders to create business value through data-driven solutions
* Collaborate with various business functions, gaining broad exposure, building knowledge and experience with banking processes and products


**Your Main Responsibilities Will Include**
* Collaborating with stakeholders to understand business needs and opportunities by leveraging data-driven insights
* Supporting to collect requirements using a variety of methods - such as data analysis, interviews, document analysis, work shadowing and process reviews
* Working independently to extract and analyze data using predetermined tools, methods, and formats to create business insights
* Performing data pre-processing, including for example data cleaning and integration, and support data engineering activities
* Applying and developing data analysis methods to various situations, sourcing data from multiple data sources
* Designing, developing and maintaining various data and analytics reports and dashboards, and securing documentation for developed codes and analytics solutions
* Supporting Analytics Engineers and Data Scientists with execution of Analytics cases and Data Science projects
* Supporting interpretation of advances and predictive analytics data, using specialized software tools and functionalities
* Supporting the creation of machine learning algorithms by applying standard statistical analysis or data preparation methods


 Simultaneously by working in the role you are being recruited to,
 **you will participate in SEB's International Trainee Programme for nine months** 
 . It will give you the opportunity to develop an extensive network within the bank, gain a deep understanding of the financial industry and be professionally and personally challenged.
   

  

 As part of the programme, you can expect to: contribute to meaningful projects, work on communication and leadership skills, do rotations in other teams across the bank, participate in a business challenge and do an international internship at another SEB site in the world.
   

  

 Key traits to thrive in this role and programme
   

  

 We’re looking for young talents who are curious, motivated, and ready to question the status quo.
   

  

**To thrive in this role and in the International Trainee programme, we believe you have:**
* Graduated within the past two years, or will graduate before the programme starts on 1st September 2026 – from a relevant academic degree
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to take ownership
* Great communication skills and to be able to work in English
* Skills in programming: R or Python for data analysis, SQL for query and manipulating databases
* Knowledge of Data Visualization tools – such as Tableau, PowerBI or Looker
* An understanding of statistical concepts and methods
* The ability to work independently as well as collaboratively to ensure implementation of analytics cases


 Previous experience (part-time work, life abroad etc.) and involvement during your studies are advantageous but
 **what matters most is your potential and passion** 
 .
   

  

 In our recruitment, SEB behaviours are something we consider when choosing whom to hire. These behaviours include creating value, acting long-term, and building positive relationships.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A nine-month trainee programme, designed for professional and personal development
* A full-time employment in the role you have been hired for, after completing the programme successfully
* A real business challenge to solve with other participants in the International Trainee and Tech Trainee programmes, where you can create value and make a difference for SEB
* International exposure with opportunities to work at SEB offices in other countries
* A caring, supportive and respectful culture
* Chances to make an impact on social or environmental issues
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Mentorship from senior leaders


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 The application period for the International Trainee programme is open until 11th January 2026 23:59 CET.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact career@seb.se, but we will not process applications via e-mail.
   

  

 The International Trainee programme will start on 1st September 2026.
   

  

**Our recruitment process**
 We want to get to know you, and for you to get to know us.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Includes**
* Psychometric tests
* Interviews – digitally and/or on-site
* A case exercise and presentation
* SEB Day – an event to learn more about SEB and the programme, with insights from former trainees


 Please note that the Alva Labs assessments will be connected to the email you applied with.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Find out more about the International Trainee Programme here: International Trainee Programme | SEB
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: SEB International Trainee Programme 2026-27: Risk Officer | SEB, Stockholm
description:
**Do you want to challenge, change, and steer our company into the future? Are you ready to make your mark on the finance industry and positively shape the world? Then you will thrive at SEB.**
 At SEB, we believe in fresh thinking, new working methods, and innovation to create a fairer and more sustainable world. Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success, while sustainability and digitalization influence our long-term strategy.
   

  

 With the International Trainee Programme and as an employee, we'll help you develop new skills and take on more responsibility to create a positive impact.
 **You will become a crucial key player in shaping the future of the bank** 
 .
   

  

 Your Trainee position and your team
   

  

**Do you like credit risk and want an exciting mix of analytical challenges and professional development opportunities?**

title: IT Consultant - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Stockholm office, we are looking for IT Consultants who will collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international client projects!
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* have a degree in computer science, informatics, business with focus on IT, or a related field
* gathered approx. two years of relevant experience in IT consulting (part or full time)
* are no stranger to the buzzwords machine learning, cyber resilience, DevOps, agile, AI, and robotics
* enjoy tackling complex digital challenges and are enthusiastic about developing and sharing solutions
* feel comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and global contexts and are flexible and willing to travel
* are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* Shape the digital future of globally leading companies in an individual client context with overarching technical solutions
* Develop groundbreaking projects by enabling your clients to effectively use agile methods and modern approaches in the context of strategic IT implementation
* Smooth the path for tailored, future-oriented customer journeys based on precise analyses of the individual situation and with current market developments and trends such as machine learning in mind
* Design and optimize unique IT architectures within the framework of enterprise solution requirements, modern custom software developments, and sustainable digital solutions, including cyber resilience


 Additional info
   

  

**How To Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: IT Manager to Klara Consulting, RAN Group
description:
**Are you a proactive, development-oriented IT professional looking for an exciting opportunity in a fast-growing company? If so, this could be the perfect role for you!** 




 RAN Group is one of the leading accounting and payroll services providers in the Nordics, operating in more than 100 locations across Sweden, Finland and Norway. We support businesses of all sizes with financial management, payroll, HR, and corporate taxation services. Our 2 700 highly skilled professionals help our 40 000 client companies drive their success.
 



**We are now looking for an IT Manager to join our team and support our operations in Sweden!** 




 This is a new position in our organization, where you will play a key role in managing our IT environment. You will be responsible for driving the development of our IT infrastructure, overseeing daily operations, and managing the services provided by our external IT partners to ensure high-quality and reliable delivery.
 



 Another significant part of the position is taking care of IT integration activities related to company acquisitions. You will work closely with various internal stakeholders and external vendors to ensure smooth system migrations, harmonized environments, and secure data flows. Our Swedish head office is in Stockholm, and we hope you can primarily work from there. In addition, occasional travel is required, primarily within Sweden, to support local teams, coordinate integration tasks, and ensure consistent implementation across offices.
 



 You will be part of our Group IT team and report to RAN Group Development Director, and functionally to our VP in Sweden. Additionally, you will collaborate with our local teams in Finland and Norway. This role in our rapidly growing company offers a combination of strategic planning and hands-on IT work. You will have the opportunity to shape our future IT landscape while also being closely involved in day-to-day execution. Your work will have a visible impact across the Swedish organization, and you will play an essential role in supporting and enabling the continuing growth.
 



**Why join us?** 




 We offer you an exciting and responsible role in one of the leading and rapidly growing Nordic organizations with opportunities for career growth and development. RAN Group is a forerunner in data-driven management and the digitalization of the accounting industry, offering you a truly motivating and forward-thinking environment to grow and make an impact.
 



 You will receive strong internal support from your team and our highly skilled expert organization, as well as modern work tools. As a flexible employer, we give you the freedom to plan your work, benefit from flexible working hours, and work remotely to ensure a smooth balance between your professional and personal life.
 



 We are committed to being the best workplace in our field! With us, every employee is valued for who they are, and we offer a supportive work environment with a fair and ethical company culture. Learn more about us as an employer here.
 



**What are we looking for?** 




 We hope you bring to the table several years of hands-on experience in IT tasks, such as managing IT infrastructure, Microsoft 365 environments, end-user devices, networking, and cybersecurity operations, as well as at least a few years’ experience in a role where you have been responsible for large-scale projects and broader IT initiatives, for example IT integrations in M&A, infrastructure modernization projects, cloud migrations, or implementation of new company-wide systems.
 



 We are looking for someone with a proactive and analytical mindset and strong communication and interpersonal skills. You have the vision and capability to drive various projects to completion, and you are ready to work in a rapidly developing and constantly changing environment. Fluency in English and Swedish is required, while Finnish is considered an advantage. We hope you can primarily work from our office in Stockholm, with flexible remote work options.
 



**We look forward to welcoming you to our team! Please submit your application by 25 January 2026.** 
 For more information about the role, feel free to contact Group Development Director Toni Hovinen. Inquiries and call-back requests via email: toni.hovinen@rantalainen.fi.
 



 To find more information about RAN Group you can get to know our leading local brands. Rantalainen in Finland, Klara Consulting in Sweden and Value Group in Norway.

title: SEB International Trainee Programme 2026-27: Product Specialist - SEB Life | SEB, Stockholm
description:
**Do you want to challenge, change, and steer our company into the future? Are you ready to make your mark on the finance industry and positively shape the world? Then you will thrive at SEB.**
 At SEB, we believe in fresh thinking, new working methods, and innovation to create a fairer and more sustainable world. Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success, while sustainability and digitalization influence our long-term strategy.
   

  

 With the International Trainee Programme and as an employee, we'll help you develop new skills and take on more responsibility to create a positive impact.
 **You will become a crucial key player in shaping the future of the bank** 
 .
   

  

 Your Trainee position and your team
   

  

**Ready to jump into our journey of becoming “the leading pension provider” in an industry going through a dramatic and exciting change?** 
 Join SEB Pension & Insurance, which is one of the largest pensions and insurance providers in Sweden, serving both corporate and private customers.
   

  

 We are consistently recognized for our expertise and customer-centric approach, which we achieve by listening to our customers, committing ourselves to quality and trust, and encouraging an entrepreneurial mindset in everything we do.
   

  

**As a Product Specialist At SEB Life, You Will**
* Be part of realizing our ambition to transform our business – where self-service and flexible products and solutions are key; and where our offers, platforms and tools are aligned with our business
* Drive our development on different levels, working hand in hand together with business owners and other stakeholders in the agile structure and the solution ecosystems
* Work on maintenance and regulatory adaptations of our products


 Simultaneously by working in the role you are being recruited to,
 **you will participate in SEB's International Trainee Programme for nine months** 
 . It will give you the opportunity to develop an extensive network within the bank, gain a deep understanding of the financial industry and be professionally and personally challenged.
   

  

 As part of the programme, you can expect to: contribute to meaningful projects, work on communication and leadership skills, do rotations in other teams across the bank, participate in a business challenge and do an international internship at another SEB site in the world.
   

  

 Key traits to thrive in this role and programme
   

  

 We’re looking for young talents who are curious, motivated, and ready to question the status quo.
   

  

**To thrive in this role and in the International Trainee programme, we believe you have:**
* Graduated within the past two years, or will graduate before the programme starts on 1st September 2026 – from a relevant academic degree
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to take ownership
* Great communication skills and to be able to work both in English and Swedish


**We Also Believe You Are**
* A team player, with a customer-focused and positive attitude
* Independent, take initiative (contributing with ideas and suggested improvements) as well as can work in a complex or fast-paced environment


**It Is Meritorious If You Have**
* Knowledge of insurance products and an understanding of new customer demands, that impact both our services as well as our offers
* Experience in driving change and you are confident in managing both strategic and operational initiatives for the products you will be responsible for


 Previous experience (part-time work, life abroad etc.) and involvement during your studies are advantageous but
 **what matters most is your potential and passion** 
 .
   

  

 In our recruitment, SEB behaviours are something we consider when choosing whom to hire. These behaviours include creating value, acting long-term, and building positive relationships.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A nine-month trainee programme, designed for professional and personal development
* A full-time employment in the role you have been hired for, after completing the programme successfully
* A real business challenge to solve with other participants in the International Trainee and Tech Trainee programmes, where you can create value and make a difference for SEB
* International exposure with opportunities to work at SEB offices in other countries
* A caring, supportive and respectful culture
* Chances to make an impact on social or environmental issues
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Mentorship from senior leaders
* Agile and modern ways of working


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 The application period for the International Trainee programme is open until 11th January 2026 23:59 CET.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact career@seb.se, but we will not process applications via e-mail.
   

  

 The International Trainee programme will start on 1st September 2026.
   

  

**Our recruitment process**
 We want to get to know you, and for you to get to know us.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Includes**
* Psychometric tests
* Interviews – digitally and/or on-site
* A case exercise and presentation
* SEB Day – an event to learn more about SEB and the programme, with insights from former trainees


 Please note that the Alva Labs assessments will be connected to the email you applied with.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Find out more about the International Trainee Programme here: International Trainee Programme | SEB
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career

title: Product Owner - Digital Sales (B2C)
description:
**Looking for a workplace for the future?** 




 At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most – relationships between people? Then you are welcome to Telenor.
 



  





 We are now looking for
 **Product Owner Digital Sales (B2C)** 
 to join our
 **Digital Channels team in Consumer Marketing.** 




  





**How you’ll make a difference with us** 




 As Product Owner for Digital Sales, you will drive the roadmap and development of our digital sales platforms and subscription journeys. You will represent commercial goals within the product organization and ensure that online buying experiences, checkout flows, and account-management features support strong revenue and conversion performance. You will balance customer needs, business requirements, and technical capabilities to deliver impactful digital sales features.
 



  





**Are you the one we’re looking for?** 




 We need someone who’s always on their toes! You have a genuine desire to learn and develop so we can continue to meet our customers’ ever-changing needs – today and tomorrow.
 



  





**Experience & Background** 



* 6+ years in product ownership in digital sales, or e-commerce product management.
* Experience in subscription-based businesses; solid understanding of telco customer journeys is a major plus.
* Proven ability to deliver high-impact features that improve conversion, retention, or digital sales KPIs.



  





**Skills** 



* Strong product management fundamentals: backlog management, user stories, prioritization, agile rituals.
* Ability to translate commercial goals into product requirements and technical specifications.
* Ability to leverage customer insights, stakeholder feedback, and data-driven analysis to guide prioritization and continuous optimization
* Proven ability to optimize product performance, monitor results, and report insights and progress to key stakeholders
* Good grasp of web technologies, APIs, and digital sales platforms.
* Strong analytical capabilities and familiarity with product analytics tools.
* Strong capability to develop, own, and clearly communicate a compelling product vision and long-term product roadmap
* Experience collaborating with engineering, design, data, and marketing teams.
* Experience aligning product priorities with overarching company strategy, ambitions, and commercial targets
* Demonstrated skill in enabling close collaboration between development, commercial, and cross-functional teams
* Experience contributing to and driving digital strategy as part of a broader digital organization







**Personal Competencies** 



* Clear communicator with strong stakeholder alignment skills.
* Forward-leaning, structured leader and collaborative team player with an agile mindset
* Customer-centric mindset with strong business understanding.
* Detail-oriented yet able to keep a strategic, holistic view.
* Thrives in fast-paced environments with complex priorities and cross-team dependencies.







**Our promise to you** 




  





**We are better together.** 




 Here, you’ll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.
 



  





**We support relationships and societies.** 




 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
 



  





**We make room for life.** 




 Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. Leadership based on trust and flexible working hours helps you balance work and life. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.
 



  





**We invite you to a career in motion.** 




 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. If you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
 



  





**Apply today!** 




 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—reach out today.
 



  





 In this recruitment, Telenor collaborates with Experis IT, which has extensive experience in recruiting IT specialists and managers. If you have any questions or need more information, please contact Recruitment Consultant Carina Eyoma at carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, +46 73-086 22 75.
 



  





 Please note that we cannot accept applications via email.
 



  





**Good to know** 




 As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.

title: Product Manager Intern
description:
**Description**
 THIS ROLE IS OPEN TO STUDENTS GRADUATING IN 2026 or 2027 SEEKING AN INTERNSHIP WITH A START DATE FROM JANUARY - JULY 2026. IF THIS MATCHES YOUR EXPECTED GRADUATION DATE AND AVAILABILITY, PLEASE CONTINUE READING.
   

  

 At Amazon, we are working to be the most customer-centric company on earth.
   

  

 Amazon is looking for passionate, versatile, and curious Product Manager Interns to join our teams across various business units. You will work on product innovation and improvement initiatives that directly impact our customers and drive business growth worldwide.
   

  

 As a Product Manager Intern at Amazon, you'll dive into a dynamic environment that empowers you to solve complex challenges, develop products, and make a meaningful impact across diverse business units.
   

  

 Note: You must have the right to work in the country of employment by the start date.
   

  

 Key Learning Objectives
   

  

**The Role Emphasizes Development In These Core Competencies**
* Customer-Centric Product Thinking: gain exposure to customer research methods and learn how Amazon identifies customer pain points.
* Product Strategy: understand how product roadmaps are created and participate in prioritization discussions.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: observe how teams work together and practice communication skills with guidance.
* Data-Driven Decision Making: learn basic product metrics and how to interpret data to inform product decisions.
* Market Analysis: assist with competitive research and understand how Amazon positions products.
* Development Process: experience agile methodologies through observation and participation in team ceremonies.
* Go-to-Market Approach: gain exposure to product launch processes and understand team collaboration.


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* You will collaborate with engineering, design, and business teams to develop comprehensive product strategies.
* You will conduct in-depth customer research and market analysis to identify emerging opportunities.
* You will define and prioritize product requirements using data-driven insights.
* You will analyze product performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.
* You will support the entire product development lifecycle from concept to launch.
* You will create clear, comprehensive product documentation for cross-functional communication.
* You will participate in strategic product review sessions with leadership.


**About The Team**
 Intern Community:
   

  

 As an Amazon Intern, you'll be part of a , supportive community that empowers your growth and development. You'll collaborate with interns from around the world, networking and participating in social events to broaden your perspectives. You can also join specialized groups focused on areas like sustainability to explore your diverse interests.
   

  

 Support:
   

  

 The internship program provides a robust support system, including weekly intern office hours, dedicated IT and HR support, and a program team committed to your success. This ensures you have the guidance and assistance needed to thrive.
   

  

 Learning Sessions:
   

  

 Exclusive learning sessions will further enhance your skills, granting you access to Amazon's learning platforms and the expertise of industry leaders. These structured development opportunities will prepare you for the next step in your career.
   

  

 Opportunities:
   

  

 Upon successful completion of the internship, you may be considered for a graduate role or a second internship, allowing you to continue your journey with Amazon. Additionally, you'll enjoy a competitive monthly salary, relocation support, and access to a range of employee benefits.
   

  

 Internship Start Dates across the year:
   

  

 We are hiring interns to start on standardised dates from January through July.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Currently in your penultimate year and working towards a university bachelor's or master's degree in Business, Economics, Marketing, Engineering or related field.
* Available for a full-time internship (40 hours/week) lasting from 3 to 6 months with a start date between January and July.
* Proficient in spoken and written English (Common European Framework of Reference C1 or equivalent).
* Analytical skills with advanced level in Microsoft Excel (e.g., formulas, pivot tables, macros).
* Basic understanding of product management concepts and customer-centric thinking.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Strong problem-solving skills with innovative solution development.
* Experience with product management tools and methodologies (e.g., Agile, user story mapping, wireframing tools).
* Excellent communication skills.
* Leadership experience through academic projects or extracurricular activities.
* Understanding of UX/UI design principles.
* Technology and market trends curiosity.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Eu Sarl, Sverige Filial - J85
   

  

 Job ID: A3143937

title: Business/Requirement Analyst for Accounts & Payments | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. The area of Cash Management is undergoing a major transformation, both from a business and market perspective but also from an architectural perspective. You will get the opportunity to contribute to the transformation by working with requirements in the Payments and Reporting area.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Business/Requirement Analyst at SEB you will play a key part in our transformation journey when building the future of payment solutions. In this role you will work cross teams to collect and write requirements in tight collaboration with your different stakeholders. The focus area for this role will be to work with requirements within our channels for private and corporate customers.
   

  

 You will be a part of the Payments and Reporting area and work against several teams, as we work cross-functionally. You will get the opportunity to discuss problems and opportunities with over ten other Business Analysts but still be self-governing and plan your own schedule. We have an open culture where teamwork is the key to our success and our colleagues are more than happy to help.
   

  

 Your daily work will entail taking lead, coordinating and driving refinement work. You will also analyze and translate business needs into functional and system requirement specifications. Communication with stakeholders at all different levels (business-/operation experts, product management, architects, development teams, QA, subject matter experts…) to set the requirements and scope will also be a part of your everyday work life.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Worked as a Business Analyst 10 years in an agile environment and are used to document requirements in a structured manner
* You have a technical background, a technical education and/or have been working as a developer or tester
* You are used to be involved in many initiatives at the same time and thrive in a fast-paced environment
* You have strong problem-solving skills and are structured and with excellent attention to detail
* You are used to coordinating and networking and using your communicative ability when working with stakeholder management in several areas
* As a person you have a strong drive and like to take initiatives, and you can define a task even if it initially is vague. You are pragmatic, adaptable and prestige less
* You have experience of collecting requirements directly from stakeholders
* You are used to working directly against development teams with developers/testers
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken
* Knowledge/experience within the payments and reporting area would be considered as advantage


**What We Offer**
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 30th of January. If you have questions about the position, please contact Hiring Manager Linn Malm at linn.malm@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts. https://sebgroup.com/career https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Plattformsspecialist
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 8 års arbetslivserfarenhet av managering och utveckling av Windows Server
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av Powershell för managering av Windows server
* Erfarenhet och kompetens av Defender XDR, Entra ID och Azure i större organisation 15 000+ klienter och servrar


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av härdning av Windows Servermiljöer
* CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional)
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsgranskningar och säkerhetshöjande åtgärder i roll som exempel IT-säkerhetsarkitekt


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 13-01-2026
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Information Technology Manager
description:
**Are you a proactive, development-oriented IT professional looking for an exciting opportunity in a fast-growing company? If so, this could be the perfect role for you!** 




  





*RAN Group is one of the leading accounting and payroll services providers in the Nordics, operating in more than 100 locations across Sweden, Finland and Norway. We support businesses of all sizes with financial management, payroll, HR, and corporate taxation services. Our 2 700 highly skilled professionals help our 40 000 client companies drive their success.* 




  





**We are now looking for an IT Manager to join our team and support our operations in Sweden!** 




  





 This is a new position in our organization, where you will play a key role in managing our IT environment. You will be responsible for driving the development of our IT infrastructure, overseeing daily operations, and managing the services provided by our external IT partners to ensure high-quality and reliable delivery.
 



  





 Another significant part of the position is taking care of IT integration activities related to company acquisitions. You will work closely with various internal stakeholders and external vendors to ensure smooth system migrations, harmonized environments, and secure data flows. Our Swedish head office is in Stockholm, and we hope you can primarily work from there. In addition, occasional travel is required, primarily within Sweden, to support local teams, coordinate integration tasks, and ensure consistent implementation across offices.
 



  





 You will be part of our Group IT team and report to RAN Group Development Director, and functionally to our VP in Sweden. Additionally, you will collaborate with our local teams in Finland and Norway. This role in our rapidly growing company offers a combination of strategic planning and hands-on IT work. You will have the opportunity to shape our future IT landscape while also being closely involved in day-to-day execution. Your work will have a visible impact across the Swedish organization, and you will play an essential role in supporting and enabling the continuing growth.
 



  





**Why join us?** 




  





 We offer you an exciting and responsible role in one of the leading and rapidly growing Nordic organizations with opportunities for career growth and development. RAN Group is a forerunner in data-driven management and the digitalization of the accounting industry, offering you a truly motivating and forward-thinking environment to grow and make an impact.
 



  





 You will receive strong internal support from your team and our highly skilled expert organization, as well as modern work tools. As a flexible employer, we give you the freedom to plan your work, benefit from flexible working hours, and work remotely to ensure a smooth balance between your professional and personal life.
 



  





 We are committed to being the best workplace in our field! With us, every employee is valued for who they are, and we offer a supportive work environment with a fair and ethical company culture. Learn more about us as an employer
 
 here
 
 .
 



  





**What are we looking for?** 




  





 We hope you bring to the table several years of hands-on experience in IT tasks, such as managing IT infrastructure, Microsoft 365 environments, end-user devices, networking, and cybersecurity operations, as well as at least a few years’ experience in a role where you have been responsible for large-scale projects and broader IT initiatives, for example IT integrations in M&A, infrastructure modernization projects, cloud migrations, or implementation of new company-wide systems.
 



  





 We are looking for someone with a proactive and analytical mindset and strong communication and interpersonal skills. You have the vision and capability to drive various projects to completion, and you are ready to work in a rapidly developing and constantly changing environment. Fluency in English and Swedish is required, while Finnish is considered an advantage. We hope you can primarily work from our office in Stockholm, with flexible remote work options.
 



  





**We look forward to welcoming you to our team! Please submit your application by 25 January 2026.** 
 For more information about the role, feel free to contact Group Development Director Toni Hovinen. Inquiries and call-back requests via email:
 
 toni.hovinen@rantalainen.fi.
 




  





*To find more information about RAN Group you can get to know our leading local brands.
 
 Rantalainen
 
 in Finland,
 
 Klara Consulting
 
 in Sweden and
 
 Value Group
 
 in Norway.*

title: Delprojektledare hårdvara
description:
**Professional Galaxy** 
 är ett IT- och teknikkonsultbolag som tillhandahåller högspecialiserad kompetens inom IT, mjukvaruutveckling, SAP, inköp, elektronik och mekanisk konstruktion. Vi samarbetar med erfarna seniora experter och levererar strategiskt värdeskapande kompetens till några av Sveriges mest komplexa och analytiskt krävande projekt. Vårt fokus ligger alltid på hög kvalitet, professionalism och tydliga, mätbara resultat.
   

  

 Är du rätt person för uppdraget, eller vill du rekommendera en stark kandidat? Tveka inte att kontakta oss.
   

  

 Ansök gärna redan idag, urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en
 **delprojektledare** 
 med 3-7 års relevant erfarenhet hos var kund.
   

  

**Om uppdraget**
 Dina arbetsuppgifter blir styrning av kundprojekt eller supportprojekt inom navala ledningssystemet 9LV, för hårdvarudelen av projektet. Det handlar om att koordinera ett team av el, mekanik, embedded SW konstruktörer samt systemansvarig för att säkra att nå leverans av kundanpassad lösning inom överenskommelse med kund. Du blir spindel i nätet mellan kundprojektet, produktion, ILS och HW projektet.
   

  

 Du har mycket goda kunskaper i Svenska och Engelska
   

  

 Heltid på plats i kundens lokaler. Urval av kandidater sker löpande. Mycket goda möjligheter till förlängning.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar med krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**Startdatum:** 
 2026-02-16
   

  

**Slutdatum:** 
 2026-07-31
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 2026-01-15
   

  

 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.

title: Senior IT-infrastruktur tekniker
description:
**Vi söker en senior IT-infrastruktur tekniker med fokus på drift, underhåll samt vidareutveckling av vår IT-infrastruktur och private cloud.** 




  





 Som IT-infrastruktur tekniker hos ISEC kommer fokus att ligga på att drifta och underhålla den IT-infrastruktur som ligger till grund för alla tekniska lösningar och den private cloud-lösning som vi producerar för att erbjuda tjänster både internt och externt.
 



 Du kommer att jobba i ett tight team som bygger, driftar och underhåller en egen IT-plattform. Du blir en viktig medlem av teamet som nu behöver förstärkning av en nyfiken och driven kollega som är villig att lära sig nya saker samt ta ansvar.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som är senior och som tidigare har tagit ansvar för en IT-infrastruktur som hostar kritiska applikationer och tjänster samt trivs att jobba både i datorhallen och på kontoret.
 



 Då vi sköter det mesta själva gällande vår IT-infrastruktur så kommer det att vara viktigt att du har en förmåga att planera, genomföra och ta ansvar för att olika projekt drivs igenom. Det kan vara allt ifrån att byta ut servrar eller trasiga komponenter i datorhallen, till att vara med och driva och planera olika projekt eller driftsättningar av nya kunder eller system.
 



 Rollen innebär frihet under ansvar och för rätt person så kan detta vara en bra möjlighet att lära sig mycket samtidigt som vi tillsammans kommer att vidareutveckla och förbättra plattformen för att säkerställa en stabil och säker leverans till våra användare.
 



 Vår plattform bygger till stor del på Microsoft Windows Server & SQL Server samt VMWare ESXi, VMWare vCenter och VMware vSAN, så ett krav är att du har gedigen erfarenhet av installation, konfiguration och löpande felsökning och underhåll av en plattform som bygger på dessa komponenter.
 



  





**Det är även meriterande om du har kunskap om:** 



* Active Directory
* CA
* DFS
* Fileserver
* Konto-hantering, grupp-hantering samt behörigheter.
* Group Policy Objects
* Dell Poweredge
* Dell Powerstore
* Fortigate
* Grundläggande kunskaper kring konfiguration av switching och routing
* Powershell
* Veeam Backup & Replication
* Windows Server Failover Cluster
* 
* Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet. Som person är du serviceinriktad, strukturerad och har god samarbetsförmåga.



 För att passa i rollen är det viktigt att du är lösningsorienterad, initiativrik och drivande i ditt arbete. Du har även goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift då du kommer att ha mycket kontakt med användare och kunder via vårt ärendehanteringssystem. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av värdepapperverksamhet är det ett extra plus i kanten.
 



  





**Varför ISEC?** 




 Du erbjuds arbete i ett företag med spännande framtidsutsikter. Du får möjlighet att i ett nära samarbete med kollegor och kunder bygga vidare på din kompetens. Du får även möjlighet att påverka din roll inom företaget. Arbetsmiljön präglas av engagemang och delaktighet. Vill du arbeta med kreativa lösningar i ett framgångsrikt, växande och hållbart företag? Då ser vi fram emot din ansökan.
 



  





**Om oss!** 




 ISEC är den oberoende och strategiska partnern för organisationer och institutioner. Genom våra finansiella lösningar automatiserar och kvalitetssäkrar vi hela kapitalförvaltningsprocessen med syftet att skapa en hållbar fond- och kapitalmarknad.
 



  





 ISEC:s mjukvarubolag äger och utvecklar plattformen SECURA, marknadsledande för portfölj- och fondförvaltning. Tjänstebolaget, som står under Finansinspektionens tillsyn, bedriver fondhotellverksamhet och outsourcingtjänster inom fondadministration, Private Banking, riskhantering och fondbokföring. Kunderna består av banker, fondbolag, värdepappersbolag och kapitalförvaltare i Norden och Luxemburg.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**TL;DR -** 
 We are looking for a data scientist to build Lovable's data and analytics muscle. You'll work cross-functionally across all teams to level up our understanding of users, uncover opportunities and empower everyone with the insights they need for data-driven decision making. Must combine analytical rigor with the ability to turn complex data into winning product bets.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with any language. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* A business-minded data scientist who's excited to level up our analytics efforts: metrics frameworks, behavioral models, and hypothesis testing
* Solid technical foundation (SQL, Python, statistical analysis) - comfortable working with data at scale and translating it into insights
* Deep curiosity about user behavior and what actually drives growth and retention
* Ability to move between exploratory analysis, building behavioral models, hypothesis testing, and strategic recommendations


**What You’ll Do**
* Work closely with growth, product, and marketing to identify key levers in the customer journey
* Analyze funnels, cohorts, and user behaviors to surface insights that drive decisions
* Build dashboards, alerts, and automated reporting to keep the team informed and aligned
* Design and analyze experiments (A/B tests, growth tests) to understand, impact and inform strategy
* Monitor data quality and collaborate with engineering to maintain reliability
* Leverage AI tools and automation to scale your analysis and focus on high-impact questions
* Translate data into clear, actionable narratives that drive product and business decisions


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React
* Backend: Golang and Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Many LLM providers
* DevOps & Tooling: Github Actions, Grafana, OTEL, , infra-as-code (Terraform)


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* Discuss your experience in more depth during a round of interviews with us.
* Join us for a workshop lasting 1-2 days remote or onsite. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

title: IT Architect - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Stockholm office, we are looking for IT Architects who will collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international client projects! We develop superior IT strategies, concepts, and solutions actively and on site, applying our technical know-how, experience in IT projects, and analytical and conceptual skills.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* have a degree in computer science, (business) informatics, engineering, or a related field
* have approx. two years of relevant experience in IT consulting or software development (part or full time)
* know that modern tools such as machine learning, cyber resilience, DevOps, agile methods, AI, and robotics aren't just buzzwords, but essential to sustainable IT architectures
* have broad technical expertise and interest in technology trends
* feel particularly comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and global contexts and are flexible and willing to travel
* are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* Shape the digital transformation of globally leading companies, ensuring their success by evaluating their capabilities and performing feasibility studies
* Manage small, agile development teams in strategic IT implementation programs, establish modern practices like DevOps and CI/CD, and be in charge of the technical implementation of crucial digital requirements such as cyber resilience
* Analyze, develop, and optimize cutting-edge, customized IT architectures while applying your comprehensive understanding of legacy IT, enterprise solutions, and current market developments and trends such as cloud computing and microservices


 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.
