title: Rock Engineer to Malmberget Mine Rock Engineering Department
description:
Are you a Rock Engineer who wants to work with one of the world’s most challenging and complex underground environments? We at the Malmberget Mine are looking for a Rock Engineer to join our team. In this role, you’ll turn geotechnical insight into solutions that prioritise safety, safeguard today’s operations, and shape the mine’s future for decades to come.
  
  

Shaping the future
  
  

At LKAB, we are leading the transformation of our industry toward a sustainable future. Just as we aim to reshape the world, we are committed to developing every individual on our team, both personally and professionally. Are you ready to help shape the future of the mining and mineral industry?
  
  

Your role
  
  

As a Rock Engineer in Malmberget, you will be part of a team whose mission is to provide geotechncial expertise and guidance, working together with stakeholders to ensure a safe, stable, and sustainable mine. You will work in one of the world’s most technically demanding underground environments, shaped by multiple ore bodies, deep mining, complex stress fields, and seismic activity.
  
  

**Focus areas:**  

* Assist with the integration of numerical stress analysis into routine mine design and production planning.
* Conduct geotechnical analyses solving a wide range of challenges from forensic analyses of ground behaviour to mine sequencing.
* Contribute to short-, mid-, and long-term projects with geotechnical expertise.
* Support strategic decision-making across the mine with geotechnical analyses.
* Work closely with mine development (operations), mine production (operations), mine planning and geology, long-term projects and research projects, developing long-lasting, positive relationships while delivering analysis- and data-based geotechnical recommendations.
* Bridge the gap between geology and rock engineering.


You will report to the Section Manager Rock Engineering and join a department of approximately 15 colleagues, many of whom are senior professionals with broad experience and specialised expertise. The team is known for its strong collaboration, deep technical knowledge and supportive environment.
  
  

What you bring
  
  

We are looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative setting and enjoys solving complex challenges. You are curious about ground behaviour and eager to explore new approaches, while keeping a clear focus on goals and long-term development. Your ability to work across disciplines and contribute with practical, solution-oriented results is what makes you valuable in this role.
  
  

**Must-have qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Rock Engineering or Mining Engineering, with relevant work experience.
* Proficiency with numerical stress analyses in 3D.
* Experience with empirical design methods.
* Fluency in English is required. Swedish proficiency is an advantage, but not essential.
* A valid driver’s license equivalent to Swedish Class B.


**Nice-to-have experience:**  

* Several years of relevant experience.
* Familiarity with Itasca’s and Rocscience’s software suite.
* Experience from caving mines.
* Experience with deep/high stress rock mass behaviour.
* Industry background in mining, tunneling, or infrastructure.


What we offer
  
  

In addition to the general benefits we offer — which you can find a bit further down — we can also offer you, who currently do not live in Sweden, the following:
  
  

* Relocation support for you and your family.
* Excellent conditions for settling in. We guide you through the official procedures necessary to settle in the country if you come from outside Sweden. We also provide temporary accommodation for a reasonable period and help you find a permanent place to live according to your personal needs.
* LKAB helps you learn Swedish, a tool for a better understanding of Swedish culture.
* The Swedish vacation law entitles all employees to five weeks of vacation per year, and four consecutive weeks during June, July, or August. Your contract may include extra vacation days.


Additional information
  
  

**Location:** Gällivare or Luleå
  
  

**Type of Employment:** Permanent, full-time
  
  

**Contact:**  

For more information about the role, please contact our hiring manager Jessa Vatcher, Section Manager Rock Engineering, phone: +46702027102, email: jessa.vatcher@lkab.com.
  
  

**Union representatives: Malmberget/Luleå:**  

* Unionen Södra Katarina Paganus, +46 970-762 98
* SACO-klubben Södra – Annika Taavoniku, +46 970-795 32

title: Experienced Analytics Engineer, Lund
description:
Job Title
Experienced Analytics Engineer, Lund
Job Description*At Axis Communications we are all about creating a smarter and safer world! We have delivered groundbreaking products for many years and will continue to do so for years to come. Join our team as an Experienced Analytics Engineer and together we will create smart and reliable analytics features!*
Who is your future team?
You will be part of the EVP METS Analytics developer team, a small and agile group of dedicated engineers, working with developing and supporting specific analytics solutions for Axis’ more special video products, including explosion protected, thermal and multi-directional cameras.
Working in our team includes close collaboration with other teams of different disciplines, as well as other analytics teams. We have very close co-operation and a friendly team spirit at Axis and strongly believe in sharing knowledge and insights. Innovation is also at our core, and we dedicate every other Friday to exploring and examining new technology.
Your role as an Experienced Analytics Engineer
As an Experienced Analytics Engineer in our team, your main objective will be to build functional, reliable, and high-quality machine learning based solutions. As part of achieving this objective, you will be expected to collaborate and communicate with engineers from other teams within Axis.
Our software responsibilities span all the way from model training and camera application development, to ensuring the optimal performance of these applications. In addition to this, we want to make sure to include a user experience and data driven approach in everything we do.
Who are we looking for?
You are curious, have a great passion for technology, love challenges, and enjoy problem solving in a team setting. In addition, we believe that you are self-driven and inspired by working in an environment of openness, creativity, trust, commitment, playfulness, and encouragement.
We also request that you have:* A university degree in computer science, engineering mathematics, or related field.
* Experience of Python, C and/or C++ programming in a Linux environment, with a strong interest in algorithm development and Deep Learning/Machine Learning.
* At least 5 years of experience in a relevant field.

What Axis has to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance - developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance - and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:
Life at Axis blog
Engineering at Axis blog
Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?  

Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.
We go through applications continuously so don’t wait – send in your application today!
In case of questions, please reach out to our Tech Lead, Katja Palmkvist, by phone +46 761 754678, or by e-mail katja.palmkvist@axis.com.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2026-02-04*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: ASIC PVT QA Engineer, Lund
description:
Job Title
ASIC PVT QA Engineer, Lund
Job Description*Are you an engineer who thrives on being the technical hub, while also loving to work hands-on in the lab? At Axis Communications, we develop the advanced chips that are the brain of our smart products. We are now looking for someone to take on a coordinating role and drive our PVT testing from start to finish.*
Your role: Coordinate, Test, and Analyze
In this role, you get the best of both worlds: you are the central point of contact for coordinating validation work while also being deeply involved in the technical execution. Your work will ensure our chips perform at a world-class level. You will:* Coordinate and Drive: You will be the key link between our ASIC design, firmware (FW), and hardware teams. You will translate requirements, specify tasks, and ensure everyone is synchronized toward a common goal. You are not afraid to challenge specifications to ensure testability and focus on what matters most. You will be the liaison who can specify and request functionality from other teams.
* Work hands-on in the lab: You will take full ownership of the practical work. You will define test plans, build test setups, and personally execute the critical PVT tests.
* Dive deep into the technology: You will work at a low level, collaborating with the firmware teams to configure the chip's voltages and clocks. You will troubleshoot complex problems and analyze how the chip behaves under extreme conditions.
* Automate and improve: You will use appropriate tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, C++) to create efficient test flows and develop tools to analyze measurement data and present your conclusions.


Who are you?
We are looking for a communicative and structured problem-solver. You enjoy seeing the big picture but are not afraid to roll up your sleeves and dive into the technical details.* You are a natural coordinator who thrives on having multiple points of contact and driving collaboration forward.
* You have practical experience with hands-on hardware testing, preferably in ASIC, FPGA, or similar fields.
* You have a solid technical foundation and an interest in understanding the entire system, from chip architecture to software interaction.
* You are comfortable working hands-on in a lab with equipment such as oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and climate chambers.
* You have strong programming skills to automate and streamline your work.


What Axis has to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide.
As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?  

Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.
We go through applications continuously so don’t wait – send in your application today!
In case of questions, please reach out to recruiting manager Mikael Andersson at mikael.andersson@axis.com.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date

We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. * Familiarity with Itasca’s and Rocscience’s software suite.
* Experience from caving mines.
* Experience with deep/high stress rock mass behaviour.
* Industry background in mining, tunneling, or infrastructure.

**What we offer**
-----------------

In addition to the general benefits we offer — which you can find a bit further down — we can also offer you, who currently do not live in Sweden, the following:


* Relocation support for you and your family.
* Excellent conditions for settling in. We guide you through the official procedures necessary to settle in the country if you come from outside Sweden. We also provide temporary accommodation for a reasonable period and help you find a permanent place to live according to your personal needs.
* LKAB helps you learn Swedish, a tool for a better understanding of Swedish culture.
* The Swedish vacation law entitles all employees to five weeks of vacation per year, and four consecutive weeks during June, July, or August. Your contract may include extra vacation days.

**Additional information**
--------------------------

Location: Gällivare or Luleå



Type of Employment: Permanent, full-time


Contact: For more information about the role, please contact our hiring manager Jessa Vatcher, Section Manager Rock Engineering, phone: +46702027102, email: jessa.vatcher@lkab.com.


Union representatives: Malmberget/Luleå:



* Unionen Södra Katarina Paganus, +46 970-762 98
* SACO-klubben Södra – Annika Taavoniku, +46 970-795 32
* Ledarna Södra – Johanna Dahlin, +46 10-144 50 16

Linus Källman Talent Acquisition Partner
Skicka e-post
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

* Free access to LKAB:s own gym and our partners´facilities in Norrbotten
* Reward program
* Wellness allowance and educational support, along with access to an art association, leisure club, mountain cabins, and family activities
* Enhanced parental pay with up to 90% of your regular salary for up to six months (after one year of employment)
* Support and assistance in cases of illness or questions about work environment, health, wellness, and rehabilitation
* Compensation for dental care and protective eyewear, including terminal glasses
* Opportunity to apply for scholarships for both your and your children’s studies
* Access to our pension and insurance program with favourable rates

title: Summer Trainee Quality Assurance
description:
**Summer Trainee 2026 – Junior Quality Assurance Software Engineer Stockholm**  



Power the future with us! Are you ready to launch your career at the heart of the energy industry? Join Fortum as a Summer Trainee and make your mark on a more sustainable world. This is your chance to gain hands-on experience, work with cutting-edge technology, and help shape the future of energy!  


**About the Role**

As a Summer Trainee, Junior Quality Assurance Software Engineer, you’ll be a vital part of our QA team. You’ll support quality assurance processes and tasks, gaining hands-on experience in a dynamic, real-world environment. Your main assignments will include:  


* Assisting with quality assurance activities in ongoing projects
* Learning and applying industry-standard QA tools and testing frameworks
* Participating in test case creation, execution, and reporting
* Collaborating with experienced team members to identify and resolve issues
* Documenting findings and contributing to process improvements
  


**About You**

We’re looking for recent graduates who are eager to learn and contribute to our purpose: powering a world where people, businesses, and nature thrive together.  


* Pursuing a technical degree (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field) with at least three years of studies completed
* Fluent in written and spoken English
* Hands-on experience or coursework in software development, testing, or quality assurance (familiarity with QA tools, scripting, or test automation is a plus)
* Committed to your work, a team player, and excited to learn new skills in quality assurance

  


**We Offer You**  


* Practical experience in quality assurance within a corporate setting
* Exposure to modern QA tools and testing frameworks
* Opportunities to learn from experienced professionals
* Insight into software development and testing best practices
* A supportive environment to develop your skills and grow professionally
* Hybrid work model with flexible hours
* Networking opportunities with other trainees

  

  

**What to expect**

You’ll receive a thorough introduction and ongoing support from your team. You’ll work on real projects with real responsibility. The summer trainee period typically runs from May to September.  


**Interested?**

If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, send your CV through our recruitment tool by February 13, 2026. For further information about the role, please contact the hiring manager Anne Marie Palm, anne.marie.palm@fortum.com, +46 764 94 04 16. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible! We will start reviewing applications during the application period, and the job ad will close as soon as the right candidate is found.  


**About Fortum**

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. We generate and deliver reliable energy to our customers and the Nordic energy system while helping industries decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations comprise efficient and best-in-class low-carbon power generation, customer services, and heating and cooling. Fortum’s power generation is already 99% from renewable or nuclear sources, with one of the lowest specific CO₂ emissions in Europe. We are guided by our ambitious SBTi-validated emission reduction targets on our way towards net-zero by 2040. For our ~4,500 employees, we commit to being a safe and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com
company_description: Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe.

title: Software Engineer - iOS
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
   

  

**About the Role:**
*We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.*
*We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.*
 As a
 **Software Engineer – iOS** 
 you will join a cross-functional team that develops innovative mobile and desktop applications aimed at improving assistive communication. While your strong iOS background will be key in strengthening this area of the team, you will also contribute more broadly across our platforms and technologies. This is a role for someone who enjoys solving real-world problems through software and is motivated by building tools that make a difference in people’s lives.
   

  

 In this role, you will work with:
   

  

* Develop and maintain high-quality software across mobile and desktop platforms
* Contribute to the architecture and design of both current and upcoming products
* Bring iOS expertise to the team and help guide best practices in mobile development
* Write clean, efficient, and testable code
* Debug and troubleshoot issues across the stack
* Collaborate with developers, designers, and product managers in an agile environment
* Stay informed on relevant technologies and help evaluate new tools and approaches
* Support and contribute to CI/CD pipelines and testing efforts


**What We're Looking For:**
 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoys working closely with others to solve problems. You’re someone who communicates clearly, is open to learning, and can adapt comfortably as things evolve. Curiosity, a proactive mindset, and a supportive attitude are traits that help you succeed, not just in delivering high-quality code, but also in contributing to a healthy and effective team dynamic.
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field
* 4+ years of professional experience in iOS development
* Solid understanding of Swift, SwiftUI, Objective-C, and the Apple ecosystem
* Experience working with iOS frameworks, APIs, and the App Store submission process
* Ability to guide others in mobile best practices and contribute to shared mobile architecture
* Broader software engineering experience, ideally including desktop or cross-platform development
* Experience with or openness to working in .NET/C# environments
* Familiarity with Xamarin and/or MAUI is a plus
* Comfortable working with CI/CD workflows, automated testing, and agile methodologies
* Strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset


 Apply today!
   

  

 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Software Engineer (Go)
description:
At Tele2 we have a vision to enable a society of unlimited possibilities. We strive for circular economy, innovation, diversity and to protect children online. We now look for a Software Engineer to operate an inhouse developed system used for Performance Management of our Mobile and Fixed Networks.
   

  

 Our Performance Management team is a technical, curious, and driven group of 18 professionals. We are dedicated to managing and enhancing the performance data across all our network infrastructures. Our team members include developers, architects, and analysts who collaborate to ensure Tele2 works data driven.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Software Engineer in our Network Performance Management team, you will be responsible for optimizing, developing, and improving the operation of our Performance Management systems. You will play a crucial role in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to measure network performance and provide insights for enhancements.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 Maintain and optimize systems built on Linux servers in a container-based environment.
   

  

 Identify possible synergies and possible optimizations in the data collection and processing layers across different products.
   

  

 Collaborate with developers, architects and analysts to enhance data processing capabilities.
   

  

 Ensure the reliability of services running in containerized environment.
   

  

 Take ownership of system operations, troubleshooting, and performance tuning.
   

  

**What We Look For**
 The person we are looking for is passionate about data and its applications for better decision making. You enjoy teamwork and to enable others by sharing your expertise in different forums. You have an analytical mindset and can combine your understanding of business and technology to deliver insights efficiently. In order to succeed in this role, a can-do attitude is crucial and you would be expected to take on relevant initiatives that supports the success of our team and Tele2s data driven strategy. Since you will work close with several parts of the business you are a skilled communicator and have a transparent and iterative way of working.
   

  

**We believe you have:**
 Proficient in Go and Kafka.
   

  

 Experience from optimization of high-speed data streaming
   

  

 Experience from DevOps in container-based environments.
   

  

 Strong knowledge of Linux, Kubernetes and GITLab.
   

  

 Experience with virtual micro service management and failover strategies.
   

  

 A proactive "can do" attitude and the ability to tackle complex and challenging systems with high data volumes.
   

  

 Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
   

  

**Personal Attributes:**
 Confidence in your technical skills and the ability to take responsibility for system operations.
   

  

 A curiosity-driven mindset with a passion for digging into challenging problems.
   

  

 Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
   

  

 Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.

title: Senior Software Engineer.
description:
Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

 Tech Stack: NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
 



**About Sinch** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



**Description** 




 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
 



 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
 



**Requirements** 



* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English



**Good to have** 



* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies



**Our Hiring Process** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Tech Lead
description:
We are an established technology-driven organisation based in Stockholm, looking to strengthen our engineering capability with an experienced
 **Technical Lead** 
 . This is a hands-on role for someone who enjoys staying close to the code while guiding and supporting a small team of developers.
   

  




 The Role
   

  


 As Technical Lead, you will take ownership of technical direction and delivery within a small, skilled team. You will combine strong technical expertise with the ability to mentor others, make sound architectural decisions, and ensure high-quality, maintainable solutions.
 



 You will work closely with product owners and stakeholders to translate business needs into robust technical solutions, while keeping a pragmatic and quality-focused mindset.
   

  




 Responsibilities
   

  

* Act as technical lead for a small development team
* Design, develop, and review solutions based on the Microsoft technology stack
* Set technical direction, standards, and best practices
* Support and mentor developers through code reviews and day-to-day guidance
* Balance hands-on development with leadership and planning
* Ensure solutions are scalable, secure, and maintainable


 Technical Profile
   

  

* Strong experience with the Microsoft stack, such as:
 


	+ C# / .NET (.NET Core / .NET 6+)
	+ Azure (App Services, Functions, APIs, or similar)
	+ SQL Server and/or other data storage solutions
* Solid understanding of software architecture and design patterns
* Experience working in modern development environments (CI/CD, Git, agile methods)


 Leadership Profile
   

  

* Proven ability to lead or guide small teams
* Comfortable making technical decisions and explaining them clearly
* Collaborative mindset with a pragmatic approach to problem-solving
* Able to balance delivery, quality, and team development

title: Fullstackutvecklare
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala försäkringslösningar? Nu söker Agria två erfarna fullstackutvecklare som vill ta en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av vår moderna webblösning. Hos oss får du arbeta i ett engagerat team där din tekniska kompetens och ditt driv verkligen gör skillnad. Vi erbjuder dig möjligheten att påverka och utveckla en plattform som används av tusentals kunder varje dag. Låter det spännande? Då vill vi gärna veta mer om dig!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som fullstackutvecklare hos Agria blir du en viktig del av vårt tvärfunktionella team där du får arbeta med hela kedjan – från idé till drift. Du kommer att vara med och utveckla vår moderna försäkringsplattform och bidra till att skapa effektiva, säkra och användarvänliga lösningar för våra kunder.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Leda teknisk design och utveckling av vår Single Page Application (SPA) med microfrontends i TypeScript.
* Ansvara för hela lösningen – från användargränssnitt till integrationer mot .NET-backend, försäkringssystem och GKL Cloud.
* Migrera och etablera lösningen i Azure, inklusive CI/CD-flöden, loggning, övervakning och driftsäkerhet.
* Implementera säker autentisering och behörighetsflöden (token handler, OAuth) i både frontend och backend.
* Vidareutveckla affärskritiska flöden såsom ärendehantering, skade- och försäkringshistorik, rabatter, betalningar (e-faktura, delbetalning, Autogiro), aviseringar, utbetalningar och policyflöden.
* Säkerställa prestanda, tillgänglighet och kodkvalitet genom robust komponentarkitektur, kodstandard och automatiserade tester.
* Skriva tester, genomföra kodgranskningar och driva teknisk kvalitet i teamet.
* Samarbeta nära Product Owner, backendutvecklare, testare samt med andra team inom SAFe-ramverket.


 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Stark kompetens inom TypeScript, SPA och microfrontends.
* Goda kunskaper i .NET (C#), REST-API:er och integrationer.
* Erfarenhet av Azure och DevOps-principer, inklusive CI/CD.
* God förståelse för frontend- och API-säkerhet (OAuth, tokenbaserad autentisering).
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbete, gärna enligt SAFe, och samarbete över teamgränser.


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Försäkringskompetens, särskilt inom djur- eller sakförsäkringar.


 Som person är du lösningsorienterad, initiativtagande och har en stark vilja att utvecklas tillsammans med ditt team. Du trivs i en miljö där samarbete och kunskapsdelning är i fokus och har förmågan att se helheten i tekniska lösningar. Du är kommunikativ, prestigelös och bidrar gärna med nya idéer för att driva utvecklingen framåt.
   

  

 Kontaktuppgifter:
   

  

 Rekryterande chef: Poja Daroui
   

  

 Facklig representant Forena: emilie.mueller@agria.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Akademikerförbundet: ellinor.jateus@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig!
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
 Agria är ett helägt dotterbolag till Länsförsäkringar och finns idag i Sverige, Norge, Finland, Danmark, Storbritannien, Tyskland, Frankrike och Irland. Vårt svenska kontor ligger på Gärdet i Stockholm, men vårt hjärta och verksamhet sträcker sig långt utanför Sveriges gränser. Med en tydlig tillväxt agenda fortsätter vi att expandera internationellt, driva innovation och utveckla digitala lösningar som gör verklig skillnad för djurägare. Ett exempel är vårt dotterbolag Agria Vet Guide, som erbjuder digital rådgivning och gör det enklare att hjälpa fler djur snabbare.
   

  

 Vi är marknadsledande i Norden inom djur- och husdjursförsäkringar, med en tydlig vision: att bli Europas mest omtyckta och pålitliga partner för djurägare. Vårt ledarskap handlar inte bara om marknadsandelar; det handlar om att skapa trygghet för både djur och människor, och att göra livet med djur enklare och roligare.

title: Power Platform AI Solutions Specialist Stockholm
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
 Som ett av Europas ledande konsultbolag inom digital transformation och med ett av Sveriges största team inom Dynamics 365, Power Platform och BI gör vi mer än att följa trender, vi skapar dem.
   

  

 Med över 50 000 experter globalt och som certifierad och managerad Microsoft Cloud Partner på högsta nivån, har vi kompetensen och specialiseringar att leverera hållbara, smarta lösningar som gör verklig skillnad. På Sopra Steria förenar vi teknik och syfte för att driva digital transformation med Azure OpenAI, Copilot, BI, Dynamics 365 och Power Platform. Tillsammans med våra kunder förenklar vi processer, stärker kundrelationer och skapar värde för både verksamhet och samhälle. Genom att tillämpa AI där det ger störst effekt hjälper vi organisationer att ta nästa steg i sin digitala resa.
   

  

 Vill du växa i en miljö där innovation, samarbete och samhällsnytta står i centrum? På Sopra Steria blir du en del av ett engagerat team som skapar hållbara digitala lösningar – i ett företag som utsetts till en av
 *Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser* 
 av Great Place to Work. Sopra Steria utökar sitt team inom Microsoft Business Applications och söker nu en person med erfarenhet inom Power Platform!
   

  

 Som Power Platform AI Solutions Specialist hos oss får du jobba i framkant med low code- och AI-lösningar byggda på Power Platform för att bidra till våra kunder och samhällets digitalisering.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har 3 års erfarenhet inom Power Platform och/eller 5 års erfarenhet av relevanta och närliggande områden.
* De senaste åren har arbetat med tjänster inom Power Platform, till exempel med automatisering eller kravinsamling.
* Har arbetat med Power Apps, Power Automate eller Copilot studio.
* Är van vid att arbeta i både svenska och internationella miljöer – du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.
* Har ett starkt konsultmässigt mindset – du är nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och gillar att jobba nära kund.


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* Erfarenhet och intresse av generativ AI
* Erfarenhet av arbete i Microsoft Dynamics och/eller Dataverse
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Sharepoint online
* Relevant utbildning inom till exempel systemvetenskap


**Varför välja Sopra Steria?**
 Hos oss får du:
   

  

* Möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom Microsofts ekosystem.
* Spännande uppdrag hos några av Sveriges mest intressanta organisationer.
* En kultur som bygger på Power of Sharing – vi lär oss av varandra, stöttar varandra och utvecklas tillsammans.
* Trygga villkor, förmåner och en arbetsmiljö där kompetens, balans och gemenskap står i centrum.


**Ansök nu – vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!**
 Vi behandlar ansökningar och kallar till intervju löpande. På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen består av tre intervjuer, personlighet- och logiktest, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll. Denna kombination av urvalsmetoder ger oss en bredare och mer rättvis bild av dig som kandidat, samtidigt som det säkerställer att både dina tekniska och personliga styrkor kommer till sin rätt. För dig som kandidat innebär det en möjlighet att visa din kompetens och potential från flera perspektiv.
   

  

 Har du frågor om rollen? Hör av dig till:
   

  

**Theresia Wiclander** 
 , ansvarig rekryterare: theresia.wiclander@soprasteria.com.
   

  

**Pu Fernqvist** 
 , Rekryterande chef: pu.fernqvist@soprasteria.com
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Vill du vara med och skapa en ny typ av finansmarknad som gör det enklare för små och medelstora företag att växa?** 




  





 På Invoier utvecklar vi en digital marknadsplats, en slags börs för fakturor, där företag kan sälja sina fakturor direkt till investerare. Det ger snabbare, mer transparent och rättvis finansiering, i en bransch som länge har fungerat på gamla villkor.
 



  





 Vi är ett fintechbolag i tidig tillväxtfas, med stöd från bland andra Europeiska investeringsbanken. Vi har kontor i Stenbeckshuset i centrala Stockholm där vi bygger en modern serverless-plattform. Nu söker vi en Senior Software Engineer som vill ta tekniskt ägandeskap, bygga vidare på arkitekturen och vara med och skala upp plattformen i takt med vår internationella expansion.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 I den här rollen får du ta ett helhetsgrepp om både teknik och riktning. Du kommer att:
 


* Driva tekniska projekt kopplade till expansion, såsom stöd för flera valutor, regulatoriska krav och effektivisering av fakturaflöden
* Vara med och forma vår arkitektur, kodbas och våra processer för leverans och drift
* Samarbeta nära CTO, affär och operations för att identifiera problem och driva lösningar
* Arbeta självständigt och ta ägandeskap över tekniska lösningar från idé till leverans
* Aktivt söka förståelse för affären, kunderna och produkten för att hitta tekniska lösningar som skapar verkligt värde



  





 Det här är en roll med stort inflytande där du får forma hur vi bygger, levererar och skalar vår produkt.
 



  





**Vår techstack** 




 Vi bygger vår lösning i molnet och använder bland annat:
 


* **Python**
* **TypeScript**
* **AWS (Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway, EventBridge, CloudFormation)**
* **Infrastructure as Code och event-driven arkitektur.**



  





 Vi söker dig som är bekväm i, eller nyfiken på, ovanstående teknik och och vill vara med och bygga nästa generations finansplattform.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Du har en stark teknisk grund, har drivit utvecklingsarbete tidigare och söker en roll där du får bygga, påverka och ta ansvar. Vidare tror vi att du har:
 



  




* Minst 4 års erfarenhet som backend- eller fullstackutvecklare
* Starkt självledarskap och förmåga att själv identifiera rätt personer att samarbeta med för att förstå verksamhetens behov
* Erfarenhet av molnbaserad arkitektur, gärna med AWS och serverless
* Vana och intresse av att arbeta tvärfunktionellt, nära både produktteam och affär
* Erfarenhet av miljöer där allt ännu inte är definierat och där du genom nyfikenhet och initiativkraft själv bidragit till struktur, lösningar eller arkitekturval



  





 Tidigare erfarenhet från fintech, marknadsplatser eller startups är meriterande, men inget krav.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* Reellt inflytande över produktens tekniska riktning
* Möjlighet till
 **delägarskap genom optionsprogram**
* Kontor i centrala Stockholm med flexibla arbetstider (4 dagar på kontoret, 1 dag hemifrån)
* Möjlighet att bygga något långsiktigt i en nischad och växande marknad
* Friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kronor
* Tillgång till kostnadsfritt gym i huset



  





**Ansök nu** 




 Skicka in din ansökan nu, urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Vid frågor, kontakta Emil Oskarsson på emil.oskarsson@ants.se.

title: Client Platform Developer
description:
**About Us**
 Hacksaw Studios is a Stockholm-based game studio focused on creating innovative, high-quality gaming experiences. With a focus on performance and precision, we bring ideas to life through technical expertise and creative collaboration. We have wide distribution, and our games are played by millions of people every month by players all over the world.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Client Platform Developer to join our growing Stockholm team. You will play a key role in building and maintaining our client-facing platforms and tools, ensuring our games run smoothly for players, internal teams, and partners.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities Include**
* Develop and Maintain: Work on core web-based products such as our in-game UI and client-communication systems.
* Integration & Collaboration: Manage client-side integrations of our games with various external platforms and support third-party studios building on our OpenRGS platform. Collaborate with back-end teams to align integration strategies with our broader platform architecture.
* Tooling & Automation: Create and maintain help-tools (e.g., scripts for changelog generation, mock clients, game launchers) to optimize workflows across different departments.
* Technical Support: Provide expertise and troubleshooting for platform-related issues, working closely with developers, QA, and customer support teams.
* UX & Visual Detail: Contribute to user-friendly interfaces and ensure a polished look and feel for our products. A good understanding of UX and a keen eye for design are preferred.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript or a similar language. (Experience with Haxe, our main client-side language, is a plus but not mandatory.)
* Strong Understanding of Web Technologies: Familiarity with browser APIs, cross-origin communication (e.g., postMessage, CORS, WebSockets), and third-party service integrations.
* Debugging & Problem-Solving Skills: Experience using browser DevTools, Postman (or similar tools), and a structured approach to identifying and resolving issues.
* Communication Skills: Ability to articulate technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Service-Minded & Proactive: Comfortable owning problems, driving solutions, and collaborating with diverse teams.


**Nice-to-have**
* Experience with Git, TypeScript, Linux, bash, npm, Bun, Docker, Cucumber, GitLab, and AWS.
* Experience working with web-related C#.


 What We Offer
   

  

* A modern office in central Stockholm.
* Work with experienced, passionate colleagues in the gaming industry.
* The opportunity to create games with a global audience.
* Real influence, ownership, and personal growth opportunities.
* Wellbeing perks including wellness allowance and regular in-office massage.


 Practical Details
   

  

* This is an on-site position in Stockholm.
* Unfortunately, we cannot assist with relocation or visa sponsorship.


 Ready to Join the Game Makers?
   

  

 Apply now! We review applications on a rolling basis.

title: Senior Produktutvecklare (Software Engineer) till Poddteamet på Sveriges Radio
description:
Vill du vara med och skapa framtidens poddupplevelse på Sveriges Radio? Hos oss får du chansen att utveckla produkter som används av över en miljon människor. Vi söker en erfaren utvecklare som vill vara med och forma nästa kapitel.
 


  


 På vår avdelning
 **Play** 
 bygger vi inte bara en mobilapp – vi bygger en helhetsupplevelse för lyssning på våra kanaler, nyheter och poddar. Vi jobbar med modern teknik, datadrivna insikter och ett uppdrag som gör skillnad. Här får du vara med från idé till färdig funktion och bidra till att skapa en smartare, mer personlig och engagerande ljudupplevelse.
 


  


**Din roll hos oss** 



  

* Utveckla poddupplevelsen på alla plattformar.
* Bidra i produktutvecklingens alla delar, från koncept till lansering tillsammans med andra utvecklare, UX-designers, analytiker och produktägare.
* Bidra till att utveckla personalisering och rekommendationsfunktioner som gör upplevelsen unik för varje användare.
* Utforska nya tekniker och bidra med arkitekturval som gör avgörande skillnader för våra användare.


  

  

**Kvalifikationer**

**Vem vi tror att du är** 



  

* Du är en erfaren utvecklare som kan röra dig mellan olika plattformar och tekniker men gärna utvecklar din kompetens ytterligare.
* Du är nyfiken, driven och trivs med att samarbeta tvärfunktionellt.
* Du har arbetat med mobilappar, webb eller backend, gärna inom media eller streaming.
* Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med personalisering eller segmentering.
* Du gillar att skriva lättläst och återanvändbar kod.
* Du har erfarenhet av att bygga appar med stort fokus på användarupplevelse.
* Du är van att ta ansvar för arkitektur och tekniska vägval.
* Du är en utpräglad teamspelare som värnar gott samarbete både inom och utanför teamet och alltid sätter laget före jaget.


  


**Vår tech-stack** 



  


 Vi jobbar med en modern stack som spänner över flera plattformar:
 


  

* **React (Next.js), TailwindCSS, TypeScript**
* **Swift, SwiftUI, Combine**
* **Kotlin, Jetpack Compose**
* **.NET Core, C#**
* **Python**
* **Kubernetes**
* **GitHub Actions**


  


**Varför Sveriges Radio?** 



  


 Vi är mer än en arbetsplats – vi är en del av svenskarnas vardag. Som utvecklare hos oss får du:
 


  

* **Flexibilitet** 
 : hybridarbete med Radiohuset i Stockholm som bas.
* **Lärande kultur** 
 : designsprintar, regelbundna hacksprintar, användarintervjuer, mobb- och parprogrammering.
* **Unika förmåner** 
 : friskvårdsanläggning, bibliotek och livekonserter på fredagar.


  


 Och framför allt – du får jobba med ett uppdrag som betyder något. Vi är reklamfria, finansierade av public service-avgiften, och vårt mål är att spegla hela samhället.
 


  


**Redo att skapa framtidens poddupplevelse?** 



  


 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

 Ansök med CV och svara på några frågor om rollen – senast
 **11 januari 2026** 
 . Urval sker löpande så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan.
 


  


**Kontakt:** 
 Sebastian Robertsson, sebastian.robertsson@sr.se
 


  


**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Utvecklare inom ServiceNow
description:
**Är du en erfaren ServiceNow-utvecklare med förmåga att även agera som lösningsarkitekt och med erfarenhet av systemförvaltning? Är du strukturerad och har förmåga att se helheten i tekniska lösningar och verksamhetsbehov? Vill du bidra med din kompetens i en myndighet som bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare? Då kan du vara den vi på FMV söker som förstärkning till vårt team som ansvarar för förvaltning och utveckling av ServiceNow.** 




  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som utvecklare inom ServiceNow på FMV kommer du att verka i navet mellan teknik och verksamhet och ta dig an arbetsuppgifter som både utvecklare och lösningsarkitekt. Du kommer att arbeta med att designa, utveckla och implementera lösningar på ServiceNow-plattformen som möter verksamhetens behov, i samverkan med andra lösningsarkitekter inom närliggande områden.
 



  





 Rollen innebär både traditionell utveckling och arkitekturarbete inom ServiceNow. Du bidrar även som teknisk rådgivare för plattformen, medverkar i förbättring av leverans och kvalitet samt stöttar vid patchning, uppgraderingar och kloning i ServiceNow on-prem-miljö. Vidare ingår ansvar för att skapa och förvalta teknisk dokumentation enligt verksamhetens riktlinjer samt att representera förvaltningen och FMV både internt och externt.
 



  





 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi söker dig som har en genomförd högskole-/universitetsutbildning inom relevant område för tjänsten, eller har motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt. Vidare behöver du ha minst 2 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete med HTML, CSS, JavaScript och AngularJS, eller annan teknik som FMV bedömer som likvärdig.
 



  





 Du har minst ett års dokumenterad erfarenhet av patchning, uppgradering och kloning i en ServiceNow on-prem-miljö. Vidare har du erfarenhet av att utveckla och konfigurera ServiceNow Employee Center, inklusive portalkonfiguration, anpassning av widgets, uppbyggnad av navigationsstruktur samt hantering av kunskapsdatabaser, kataloger och formulär. Du har även tidigare erfarenhet av att skapa och underhålla dokumentation av funktionalitet, användarflöden och tekniska lösningar enligt verksamhetens riktlinjer, exempelvis i form av systembeskrivningar, flödesscheman eller användarmanualer.
 



  





 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av utveckling i olika moduler inom ServiceNow, exempelvis ITSM, SPM, HRSD, CSM, IRM eller annan modul som FMV bedömer som likvärdig. Certifieringar inom ServiceNow är meriterande, såsom Certified System Administrator (CSA), Certified Application Developer (CAD) samt relevata Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS). Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps eller motsvarande, agilt arbetssätt och ITIL 4 är meriterande, liksom erfarenhet av att identifiera och hantera säkerhetsrisker.
 



  





 Personliga egenskaper är av stor vikt för oss. Vi välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter och söker dig som är du trygg och stabil med god självinsikt. Du är strukturerad och självgående samt tar ansvar för att planera, driva och följa upp ditt arbete. Du har god förmåga att se helheten, arbetar effektivt och uthålligt även i komplexa situationer och bidrar till att nå gemensamma mål.
 



  





 Du har en positiv inställning och skapar engagemang, delaktighet och motivation i samarbeten. Genom att lyssna, kommunicera tydligt och lösa problem på ett konstruktivt sätt bidrar du till ett gott samarbetsklimat.
 



  





 Du behärskar svenska och engelska väl, både i tal och skrift.
 



  





**FMV - Försvarets materielverk** 




 På FMV är du med och bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare. Vi har i uppdrag att förse det svenska försvaret med den senaste tekniken och kunskapen så att de kan försvara vårt land och våra allierade. Tillsammans med kompetenta och engagerade kollegor får du vara med och utveckla och upphandla det som ibland inte existerar än. Du driver utvecklingen, hela vägen från behov till leverans. Från idé till verklighet.
 



  





*Du kommer att arbeta på infrastrukturstaben som* 
 ansvarar för utveckling, förvaltning och drift och av informationssystem. Arbetar för att styra myndigheten inom IT-området genom att planera, genomföra och följa upp IT-verksamheten inom FMV. Avdelningen IT Utveckling och Förvaltning ansvarar för utveckling och förvaltning av applikationer, både för FMV:s eget behov och för Försvarsmakten.
 



  





 FMV är en myndighet som sorterar under Försvarsdepartementet med Försvarsmakten som tillsynsmyndighet. Vi använder oss av Försvarsmaktens säkerhetsregelverk KSF som grundläggande i FMV:s ackrediteringsmetod för säkerhetsgodkännande av våra informationssystem.
 



  





 Hos FMV erbjuds du en trygg anställning med bra förmåner:
 


* Kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter
* Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till distansarbete i den mån arbetet tillåter
* Tjänstepension och friskvårdsbidrag



  





 Läs mer om FMV som arbetsgivare och om de förmåner vi erbjuder på vår hemsida: Arbeta på FMV.
 



  





 Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens försvar? Välkommen med din ansökan senast den
 **2020-01-19.** 




  





**Bra att veta** 



* Du ansöker genom att bifoga ditt CV, betyg och intyg på svenska.
* I ditt CV beskriver du tydligt på vilket sätt du uppfyller efterfrågade kvalifikationer och meriter. För att skapa en mer inkluderande rekryteringsprocess ber vi dig att inte skicka personligt brev eller inkludera bild i ditt CV.
* Vi rekryterar kompetensbaserat och bedömer kandidater utifrån rollens krav på erfarenhet, kompetens och personliga egenskaper.
* Våra fackliga företrädare är Stefan Hållander (SACO), Lena Sköld Gunnarsson (OFR/S), Lars Mörrby (OFR/O) och Peter Andersson (SEKO). Alla nås på telefon 08-782 4000 (FMV Växel).
* Vid frågor om tjänsten kan du kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Carina Eyoma på Experis IT, carina.eyoma@se.experis.com alt. 073-086 22 75.



  





 #LI-Hybrid
 



  





 För att jobba hos oss behöver du vara svensk medborgare och genomgå en säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar provanställning och som anställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Ansökningar till befattningen tas endast emot via FMV:s webbplats eller registratur. Vi har gjort vårt medieval och undanber oss därför försäljning av annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Researcher in Open Source technologies
description:
Are you interested in exploring how new and improved software engineering practices can enhance the sustainability and cybersecurity of digital infrastructures and software supply chains across industry and society? And are you particularly interested in those built on open-source technology building blocks? Do you want to work in applied research projects that examine how sharing and collaboration can shape the future of mobility? If so, RISE Mobility and Systems offers an exciting opportunity for you.
 



  





**About Us** 




 At Sustainable Transport and Systems, we conduct applied research with the aim of exploring the opportunities offered by digitalization and electrification for vehicles, logistics, and transport systems. Our research employs various methodologies and is carried out in close collaboration with stakeholders in the transport and automotive sectors. Most of our projects are funded by research financiers, but we also have some directly funded projects, such as investigations for authorities and research projects with Swedish companies.
 



  





 The unit works closely with academia, industry, and the public sector. Our researchers and experts are located in Lund, Gothenburg, Kista, and Umeå. The location will therefore be one of the four cities, and we follow a hybrid work model that allows you to split your working time between the office and your home workspace.
 



  





**About The Position** 




 We are looking for a senior researcher with a strong interest in software engineering, particularly in the context of open source technologies, including software, data, AI, and hardware. In this role, you will help expand our research activities within our existing industrial ecosystem, while also building new partnerships and strengthening collaboration with universities and institutes focused on digitalization, societal impact, and future mobility.
 



  





 The current role involves working on issues related to open technologies, such as open standards, open data, and open platforms. The purpose is to promote transparency, interoperability, and innovation in the development of future solutions. The work is carried out in close dialogue with various stakeholders and is an important part of creating sustainable and long-term robust systems. You will work in a passionate team with a lot of individual freedom.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




 To succeed in this role, you will need:
 



  




* Ph.D. or extensive experience in a relevant field of research.
* Knowledge about one or several of these areas: software supply-chain security, cyber security, and software engineering.
* Knowledge of one or more of the following: collaborative software engineering, open-source software, open-source AI, open data, and open-source hardware.
* Knowledge in areas such as resilience, digital sovereignty, interoperability, AI, procurement, and cybersecurity and how they interplay with regulatory frameworks governing adoption and role of open technologies in industry and society.



  





 The following non-exhaustive list shows areas of expertise and abilities which are of particular interest for the position:
 



  




* Experience in working on research projects with private and public entities.
* Experience in project management and securing funding for research projects.
* An interest in adopting experiences in standardization, sharing, and collaboration of open source technologies in areas such as mobility, energy, and automotive.



  





 We are looking for someone who is proactive and self-motivated, with a strong ability to take initiative and drive tasks forward. You thrive in collaborative environments and enjoy working as part of a team, while also being comfortable taking ownership and working independently. Strong communication skills are essential, as you will interact with colleagues across different functions and contribute to a positive and productive team dynamic.
 



  





**Welcome with your application!** 




 If this sounds interesting and you want to know more, you are welcome to contact Research Leader and Acting Unit Manager at Sustainable Transport and Systems Taline Sandberg Jaadan, taline.jadaan@ri.se. The application deadline is January 11. Selection and interviews may take place continuously during and after the application period. Apply without cover letter.
 



  





 Our union representatives are Ingemar Petermann, SACO, +46 10 228 41 22 and Linda Ikatti, Unionen, +46 10 516 51 61.

title: Master thesis - Continuous optimization, control and machine learning
description:
Continuous optimization of indoor climate prediction models for smart climate control system
   

  

**Background**
 Munters, a global leader in indoor climate control, is striving to always provide customers with the most precise and energy efficient equipment possible. The purpose of a climate control system is to maintain a certain humidity, temperature, or air quality required for e.g., production or storage of sensitive products. The control system should reliably attenuate disturbances and quickly track setpoint changes, to maintain the desired, stable indoor climate.
   

  

 Advanced humidity control and monitoring systems often incorporate black-box models to enable features such as predictive control, predictive maintenance and anomaly detection. The performance of these features is highly dependent on the accuracy and robustness of the underlying models.
   

  

 To ensure sustained performance and adaptability as environmental or system conditions change over time, it is essential to implement effective model updating strategies. This project aims to 1) explore a new application of a predictive model and 2) develop a reliable methodology for updating predictive black-box models based on recent operational data.
   

  

**Project Objectives**
* Explore a new (possibly unsupervised) application incorporating a prediction model.
* Identify performance metrics that signal model degradation and trigger the need for model updates and assess the impact of model degradation on the proposed application/functionality.
* Develop a model updating methodology including a data selection strategy to ensure that re-training data is representative and informative.


**Expected Outcomes**
* A methodology for predictive model updating, including criteria for update initiation, data selection, and fallback mechanisms, exemplified by application to a new functionality incorporating a predictive model.
* Demonstration of the proposed methodology on data from a test system.


**Qualifications**
* Familiarity with system identification and/or machine learning techniques.
* Familiarity with data analysis and/or statistics.
* Programming skills, preferably Python.


**Contact**
 Fredrik Raak, Research Engineer
   

  

 Munters Europe AB
   

  

 Kista, Sweden
   

  

 Email: fredrik.raak@munters.com

title: Senior Salesforce Systems Specialist
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**
 As a Senior Salesforce Systems Specialist, you will play a crucial role in the CRM Systems team. Your role will be to translate complex Go-to-Market business needs into high-quality, scalable technical solutions across our GTM tech stack, with Salesforce as its core. In this senior position, you will also act as a technical expert for the team, supporting solution design, reviewing complex solutions, and guiding architecture and integration decisions.
   

  

 The CRM Systems team's mission is to build and manage the core tech stack that powers our Enterprise Go-to-Market operations, directly supporting and empowering our Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success teams. You will be accountable for the end-to-end delivery of your solutions, guiding them from initial technical design and build through successful deployment and user adoption. In this senior role, you will also contribute to larger, more complex projects, act as a cross-team expert in integrations, and serve as a technical representative of the CRM Systems team. Your work will be directly tied to our strategic roadmap, and you will be a critical player in major transformation initiatives.
   

  

 This is a high-impact opportunity to solve complex challenges that are critical to achieving key business results and company targets.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**
* Design, build, and deploy robust, maintainable, and efficient solutions using our full GTM tech stack, including Salesforce, Gong, MCAE, Sales Navigator and other connected systems
* Own the end-to-end delivery of user stories, from translating business needs into technical designs to testing, deploying, and monitoring changes in production.
* Review solution designs and code from other team members, ensuring scalability, reliability, and alignment with architectural standards.
* Contribute to architecture discussions and guide integration strategies across systems, acting as a subject-matter expert.
* Handle complex technical issues by troubleshooting, fixing bugs, and ensuring the long-term health and performance of the delivered solutions.
* Actively participate in the team's agile processes, including peer reviews of declarative configurations to ensure high quality across the platform.
* Continuously review, retrospect, and adapt, (re)learning and (re)iterating based on new knowledge and experience. Contribute to well-functioning collective ownership and decision-making.


**Requirements**
* Strong expertise in Salesforce solution design and automation, with deep understanding of CRM architecture and integrations.
* Proven experience supporting B2B sales processes with systems and a deep understanding of the associated business logic.
* Demonstrated experience leading CRM system implementations, from business requirements to final solution design.
* Ability to take ownership of complex solutions end-to-end, and contribute to integration architecture across systems.
* Senior-level consultative skills, including the ability to guide architecture discussions, lead requirement intake sessions, and provide technical mentorship to the team.
* Experience driving larger-scale or complex projects, with the ability to work independently with ambiguous or evolving requirements.


**Nice to have**
* Proven experience implementing B2B Saas CRM architecture
* Technical architecture certification
* Previous experience in a consulting or technical lead role.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

***Welcome to Tune In - our behind-the-scenes video series where we sit down with the brilliant minds shaping the sound and story of Epidemic Sound. In this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound sits down with Rikard Herlitz, Chief Tech Officer where he shares what makes developers most happy, what velocity means to him and how Epidemic Sound is in the sweet spot when it comes to AI.***
***Thinking about joining us? Tune in - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.***
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**
